pHV4CLYSJZDLqH-td1XDEA.text: I have been holding back on writing a review on this place for over a year but today was different. I had a great experience tonight with multiple factors involved. I had the Bianca Vigna bottle that was just Devine. I sat at the bar with my wonderful wife and a family friend so it was just a great atmosphere. An unexpected plus was the lovely ladies from El Paso sharing great foodie tips. Postinos has a simple menu but yet established choices with a hint of wow. Simply saying that it's a wonderfully exquisite spot.

TZ_IMncfnyPyOI2VCzq2Pw.text: First time here and definitely not the last! Fantastic food and great happy hour prices.  Visit them, you'll love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Butcher board.

EpOqaG791O-9IuwnqHfpSQ.text: Met up with some of the girls for breakfast on Sunday and the place was jumping, as usual.  I want to say, up front, that this place was my absolute favorite for HH a couple of years ago....nice patio, tremendous service, and good wine.  I was there at least once a week with a variety of people BECAUSE of  the extra touches.  My last few experiences have ranged from lackluster to "meh" and I've decided it's because of the service and not the food.    This trip was no different...from the hostess who let me stand 2 feet in front of her for about a minute without acknowledging me, to the server who seemed not to feel well and had no real patience for our slowness in ordering.    It just looks like this team was not having a good time at work.  There were some notable exceptions; the bartender very pleasant and the young lady who took us to our table was nice as well.  I miss the smiling faces and the energy of folks who enjoy their jobs.  I have no quibbles with the food at all....loves me some tomato jam bruschetta, the salmon plate, pickles, and a range of other tasty treats but brunch is also about ambiance and I expect so much more when I'm spending $100 for a table of four.    This neighborhood is filling up with good restaurants and what separates one from the rest is the general comfort and welcoming vibe.  I fervently hope that this location begins to value this very simple concept as the market becomes more competitive.  So, how does Postino get to that 4th, or even 5th, star??  Say Hi to me when I come in.  Smile at me and say "Be right with you". Swing by and ask how my food is. Don't tell me you "have" to be here.  I can think of several other things but these are quick and don't cost anything.  Until then Postino, you aren't a destination for me.

5_0ITZwe04FR9xYFMNOM3w.text: POSTINO IS THE BEST. The service, the food, the atmosphere! It's all great. I'd recommend a specific food item but you really can't go wrong. Well okay, you HAVE to try the bruschetta! & of course a glass of wine. Enjoy! :)

-yYgvD6m9Yoh0jxgHDm5Vw.text: Great ambiance.  We went here for brunch the morning of my wedding. I had the scramble, delicious. Mimosas are a must have for brunch.  I cant wait to go back and try the other menus when its cooler out.

dDsp5cW-Ij94eEJDiOg8MA.text: Love the patio and atmosphere and the food is seriously delicious! Go! I had the bruschetta and its huge enough for 2! We will definitely be returning for Monday's 20$ bottle of win me and bruschetta!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio!
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta=amazing!

WMETq4XboNlDlKh0JxWBqw.text: Very nice place! Love the fact that I can still walk into a place and turn heads. I love it! The service was great!  Tried the Bruschetta Sampler that I've heard so much about with a bottle of Prosecco. It was fantastic! I'm definitely bringing all my girlfriends here for a night out!

zHHYHbnVrvphMzR25c0SwA.text: Postino, I love you.  I love absolutely everything about you.  My biggest concern is the anxiety I get when it comes time to order.  There are SO many things on the menu that I love, and I'm trying to maintain a girlish figure, so I can't order everything.  My absolute favorite lunch is the prosciutto/fig/brie sandwich on ciabatta with the mixed greens salad.  The fried shallots, pear, candied nuts, and grapes make it an unforgettable dish, and the salty-sweet combo in the sandwich is perfection.  Their lemonade is the best in town, and it is a steal when you factor in the free refills.  Of course, their wine list is extensive and amazing... but I just can't seem to give up my lemonade!   The service is always good.  Unobtrusive, knowledgeable, and friendly... plus a little hipster (but not TOO much).  It is always on my most-recommended list to friends and visitors.  Their consistency and quality are always spot-on.  If you haven't been, then get yourself there pronto!

US11o1EdzPtKP1oNF72mpA.text: Bruschetta....YES PLEASE.    Fantastic food, fantastic service.  Can't wait to share an evening with my wife here again.

uqXSABAv34dJOqoILhEaJg.text: Food is amazing and excellent flavor combinations. Can be crowded in the evenings. And you need to be in the mood for bread.

BOatDfp0m4C4bjPr9r0eXQ.text: Love this place. The only bad part is they've done away with the valet and parking is simply terrible. Their Malbec is absolutely my favorite. I crave their bruschetta on the daily. So delish!

N4rAHj8QcrnOn5rFea7Urw.text: All the boards here are get. I love the fig one. The smoke salmon and pesto is also tasty. Go when they have a board and bottle for 20$ really great deal

bOJvpVqxworgZV8r5Lvv0w.text: Excellent food, nice service (when you have two people bring the orders out) for a table of four. Their bruschetta... period.

dc8-xt4lxpmFrcgG6hYfNw.text: I have been coming here for years and recently returned for brunch. I have no idea what happened. From start to finish it was nothing like it used to be. Maybe since they have opened the other locations the owners and partner's just seem to have forgotten about the first one. The hostess was completely rude after telling us there was going to be a 30 minute wait for a table inside she refused to let us take a table out side on the patio when there where 4 open tables and I explained we would just have drinks and one  appetizer there because I needed to feed my child why we waited, and when the table was ready we would move inside . She refused to take our name for the inside table and said, if we take an outside table we could not move inside because it's too confusing for the server to have to move us.  I didn't realise its the severs job to move and reseat guests. After we were seated outside in the 104 we were brought 3 waters for a party of 4 about 7 minutes later a fourth finally arrived and our drink order was taken.  Those took 15 minutes to come. Then a different person whom I believe was our actual server walks up to the table and says ,"  What do you want brunch is about to end!"  Not even,  Hello, Do you have any questions? We ordered and the food did come out fairly fast! The food was good and that was consistent. My daughter enjoyed her Granola.  I was the last one still eating and clearly I am no where near done and still eating starts to reach across me from my right side to my mother, who is sitting to my left and why reaching asks her,  "can I take that?"  He started to take the plate before she could even answer!  With his smelly arm pit in my face why I am still eating . The fact that his serving etiquette was rude to start but that its summer and we are in Arizona and he's sweating to cross over my plate and put his open arm pit in my face is appalling.  At that point I couldn't finish eating. Requested the check immediately. Too bad the owners have let the customer service go down hill. This place really used to be a great place were the servers took pride in their job and it was considered a great spot. Won't be going back.

pyCwKqH6-FKK_DYALbyiCg.text: I just love the concept, for a winelover this is the place, like the atmosphere/vibe, the staff and the bruschettas wow delicious.

bycXUNTEINbqieEZ1saXnw.text: One of my absolute favorite spots in Phoenix. The atmosphere is fun, romantic, and relaxing. Music is always cool too. The food is fantastic and prices on wine by the bottle are great. The bruschetta combination options never disappoint. My personal favorite is the prosciutto, marscapone, and fig spread. Perfect combination! Close seconds are the smoked salmon/pesto, Burrata/bacon/arugula/tomato, and the classic Mozarella/tomato/basil. The service and food are always great and consistent.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Butcher&#39;s Block

YUPp-VUhrhyDo2OhjFpB1g.text: Super good food and very beautiful scenery outside. Love that it's dark and very romantic. If you're looking for a place like a first date or just a nice night out with your friends. This is the place to go. Good food, and I'm pretty positive the plates go with wine.

KwvWOR2fljGCSEaoyrQ_9Q.text: This place is sheer genius. The bruschetta boards (what IS that olive oil?!), great wine selection, and super cool ambiance make it clear why this place is so highly rated. Every time we head to Phoenix, this chic hangout is the first stop we make!

hEfwcTjcYzE9Md2I_AUV0A.text: I went to Postino Central last night, the food and wine were de-lish, the service was terrible. The hostess who greeted us was very friendly and professional. After that, it really went downhill from there. Disclaimer: it was a very slow night; the restaurant was half-empty.  Part I: The first waiter promised to bring an extra side of brie since we were skimped a little on the fruit and cheese board. He stopped by a few times saying he'd do it (each about 20 minutes apart) and then finished his shift and left without letting us know. So we actually had no idea that we were server-less until we finally stopped to ask someone else.  Part II: The new server who took over was really nice, but kept disappearing. Half an hour after ordering a dessert he let us know he forgot to put it in. He was really polite about it and took it off our tab, but one of the other servers mentioned, "I thought you said you were full anyway". It was a little snarky and just made us a little more irritated about waiting for two desserts for 35 minutes.  Parking at this location isn't very convenient. I had to valet my car and then the valets wanted to take off for the night so they said they'd just give us our keys back. I felt obligated so I tipped them, but it left a weird taste in my mouth.  I was disappointed because I've heard such amazing things about Postino and it just seemed like the staff really didn't care about helping us. Maybe it was just an off night, it was slow and Thursdays are pretty hit-or-miss at most businesses. Either way I'm not in a rush to head back there. Aside from the initial hostess who sat us, the servers seemed a little fake; like they were just trying to get through the shift with tips, but didn't genuinely care at all about our experience. Saying they'd help, they'd be right back and then disappearing for twenty minutes, (or in the first server's case; forever). At the prices they charge, it's just not worth it.

ywdymT8GLy-xWEeT32IkQQ.text: I had an incredible experience at Postinos. We sat outside and it was a bit chilly but they had the fire places and the heaters on, it was the perfect set up. Our server went out of his way to educate us on our wine selections by bringing us several samples when we didn't even ask and made the experience extremely enjoyable. The food was absolutely incredible. I could not say enough good things about this place!!

b41qmG4FFGVpO95HthUk_Q.text: Girls Nite Out! Literally, went with two friends and this place was packed with the same. We split the four pack bruschetta, salad and a meat board. All were very good.  Waitress was very informative.

ozKyj-wD2CvH0ndP9VvtaQ.text: Came for Sunday brunch, entertainment brain chartrand was playing music outside. Was the perfect mix of easy listening and great environment. Great patio great music great memosas. Really classy which is what I look for. The staff was descent. Mostly really friendly and nice. Great coffee. Food was great as well. Will come back for Sunday fundays.

Yx1gsr-1iE_DKxlpyZlDPw.text: The waiting is too long!! They should expand their patio , offer a complementary drink if you wait is more then an hour ! Who waits an hour to go out to eat! This is the reason i dont come here. She wanted to come here!

bW7K5mYzzItjoDchSCxApA.text: Best bruschetta in town! Great variety of choices. Yummy crusty bread.  Awesome wine selection. Go before 5 (any day of the week) and get wines by the glass for $5- great deal!  Great date place- nice patio and hip interior. Can get a little loud on Friday and Saturday nights.

Kcj0_eCQkducU7lKxRkQug.text: I have been in the valley for almost a year and this is by far my favorite place for lunch or brunch.  chicken and mozzarella sandwich is so good that I order it every single time I go.  I rarely get to sample anything else because everyone finishes their plate.  quick tip, sit at the bar if you can, service is much more attentive.

VKMrMgquYQqX_aUnNq1Uag.text: I absolutely love this place.   The bruschetta is always yummy and fresh. But, not only is the food excellent, so is the service. I will keep returning, because its always a pleasant experience

NNAdfDtR09O-ONgeweN5pA.text: Second time i came in, food is pretty expensive, but its well worth it.  I do recommend getting the bruschetta, you pick 4 different ones (which are cut into nice 4 slices each). We got the salmon, roasted peppers, tomato jam, and procsiotto (sp?). They were really good, i think i want to try some others ones, definitely don't get all of one kind unless you are afraid of change. If that is the case i don't know why you are trying somewhere new to eat.  Food was really good, i got the half panini and soup of the day. The panini i chose was the 9 iron. Not enough burratta i love the flavor of burratta, and just enjoy having a few of them to eat. Oh this is making me long for some fresh burratta.

jfPF1-wPjR7rz4DDP8S-aA.text: Excellent wine, food, and service! My boyfriend took me there tonight,  first time for both of us.....we will be back and will bring friends

Qtl6SmIccPe-GE1QY1qzLg.text: Once again, Postino's scores. Took some friends from Illinois and they all loved it. We ordered the bruschetta board of course and each shared sandwiches and salads. All were happy with the food, service, and happy hour drink prices. We went there with 3 kids so my only suggestion would be make sure the parents get that kids menu right away because they were sweating the choices just a bit. All were immediately happy when presented with the kids menu. I love Postino's and can't wait to go back again.

ZRbMWJuDjYZol5NnUl2CEg.text: Bruschettas were very tasty and hearty ingredients. Great atmosphere and friendly service. One down side was not serving espresso which would have topped it off and made a 5/5 brunch

3OghbpZdiqnyECu9NDUEWw.text: This place is awesome. It's so awesome they are always packed. Try to go during happy hour and you'll be lucky to find a seat. The enviroment is relaxed and feels good on the inside. Most are dressed in formal or business attire. Food is really good and drinks are reasonably priced. I would recommend Postino's to anyone. When I get a chance I always take it to go here. By the way parking sucks, if you don't arrive early enough good luck finding parking or using the valet.

KDVtFRSniSqSr_dHwG2T3A.text: Definitely not a stuff-your-face kind of place but more of a nice, chill evening with a date or friends where u can drink great wine and snack on so AMAZING bruschetta.  Recommendation: 4 Bruschetta for $12. They are big enough to share and a variety of different choices. ( I loved the Brie, Apple, and Fig spread)

fWEoYm_XHLPjNZLLOIr0SA.text: Very pleasant hip restaurant. Try as many Bruchetta options as you can; each order comes with 4 pieces (potentially 4 different toppings), and all the ones I got were delicious: Brie & Apples with Fig Spread, Tomato Jam & Fresh Sheeps Milk Cheese, Prosciutto with Figs & Mascarpone, and Fresh Mozzarella with Tomato & Basil.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ciabatta French Toast
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cucumber honey lemonade

KVRletB96cBhF3ZKkfMuiQ.text: I'm taking away a star. Boo!  I heard a rumor that the ownership of Postino has changed hands. Whether this is True or not, I have noticed a significant change in the quality of service. Not 1, not 2, but 3 visits in a row, when I ordered the same dish, they completely screwed up my order and left me waiting for over 30 minutes. It was only the last time that they took care of it on the check.  I still love the food, the wine is great, and the atmosphere is swanky. I am less anxious to bring friends and family there now, though.

B9cyQ_s6zDwf1U1zxwx-sQ.text: Walk, bike, light rail or drive, but get to Postino Central.  Postino Central is a definite favorite of mine, especially for late afternoon/happy hour food and drinks. It's tough to beat. The indoor/outdoor bar is fab. Service is always great and food is always better. The bruschetta, the hoegarden, the paninis, the hoegarden.  And don't forget the brunch, it's amazing. The scones, the egg sandwich, the french toast are all amazing.  Brian DeMarco's Trio plays here on Sunday afternoons too.  if you are looking for a great place to hang out, people watch and enjoy amazing food and drinks, this is the one.

xDQmsqpPRmDjK7FCyuIc7w.text: Cant get enough of this place! My favorite part lately has been that you can get the lunch combo with 2 different sandwiches!!! I always have a hard time deciding what to order. I definitely know what type of foods/items I will choose. Only rarely, do I completely step out of the box when it comes to food. I just don't like to leave disappointed! The Nine Yard is beyond delicious!  And you have to order the focaccia bread! So light and soft, but filling too! The bacon is quality and was perfectly juicy and crispy. Love to add bacon to most dishes, I have to admit ;) I would have loved to have pesto on this sandwich instead of the dijonnaise. (sp?), but it had the perfect ratio of meat, veggies, bread! Yum!!! I also ordered the Chicken and Mozzarella sandwich. This one is excellent! I had been expecting a chicken breast, so be ready when the chicken comes thinly sliced like lunch meat! The mozzarella is SO fresh and the sun dried tomato mayo is unbelievable. I almost wanted to ask for more. haha! For me, I'm used to ordering a combo lunch with salad or soup. To just get 2 halves of 2 sandwiches I was wanting to order is the best of both worlds! The sandwiches had plenty of greens on them, therefore, just get chips! They are crisp and taste soooo fresh! You may even have leftovers to eat later on! Another bonus is the $5 wine until 7pm or the $5 pitcher! Cant beat that! We would have indulged if we werent on lunch break at nursing school! The brain cells really need to be available for more information ;) I really need to find a friend to indulge in bruschetta with me because they look and sound, AMAZING, just too much for 1 person to eat! They do offer a $20 bruschetta and bottle of wine on Mondays or Tuesdays! Anyone care to join me?!??

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half Nine Iron Half Chicken Mozarella!!! Chips, of course!

kcPOUD1nVRI_elJw4K4Qww.text: Oh how I love the mellow feel of Postino. The people watching....the devouring of deliciously simple food and wine. I do NOT love the ridiculous wait times which seem to be a problem more often than not.  This location accommodated my birthday party which was really nice. The mixed greens salad with those devilishly good candied pecans and frizzled leeks is something I could eat buckets full of.   I don't understand the bruschetta bullshit though. Their bruschettas are largely bread! Little in the way of the toppings. Kind of a disappointment. And the bread isn't even THAT great (unless you were raised on shitty bread).

ZPIcjfsChClQLYgJafZ-5Q.text: I absolutely love their bruschetta and wine selection. This is my favorite place to have a drink with a friend or to take out of town guests. I highly recommend at least trying it once, or if you are like me, visiting at least once a month!

FkXXMujsZHwnSQYas3pohw.text: My favorite place in PHX.  Do yourself a favor - order every type of bruchetta and triple up on the Tomato Jam! These are delicious and fun to share with friends.

wQXTNK12sw9Y7NiNhIRqgg.text: Really........FOUR stars on the previous review Kristi....realllllllllyyyy?  The food and drink, as always, is on point. Occasionally, they make small changes to the bruschetta menu which I enjoy because hey, who doesn't like to try something new when you're pretty confident it's going to be AMAZING! Helloooo Burrata, Bacon, Arugula & Tomatoes!!  There is some kind of crazy love vortex (minus the twisted trees) surrounding this Postino location. Seriously, everyone else disappears. Don't plan a date here unless you are prepared to eventually propose or accept said proposal.   Don't say I didn't warn you.

4aE-IkTGsNw6t0JG3zbPQw.text: I love all of the upward project restaurants. I especially like this location of Postino's. I've come here a number of times and tonight was one of my favorites. I hate when I asked for a taste of one of the beers and they serve it to me and a warm glass.  Madeline made sure that the glass that I got to taste the beer was cold without even asking. I had a bruschetta board   My favorite is the arugula with bacon and tomato. I also love the salmon with pesto and I asked them to add extra arugula which they did with no problem.  I never want to be a high maintenance customer, but I do like when you have small requests and they have no problem satisfying them. The employees here are great. I especially like Maddelein and Slade. They go above and beyond to make sure you enjoy your visit. Give this a try at happy hour

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Slade works behind the bar also during happy hour and keeps the customers happy
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Madeline was our main server tonight and she was fantastic
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Time for HH!! Watching the sunset

6JZ3Isk4XPnDD2IJ9PHy2Q.text: Best part of this visit was the high energy, super attentive and friendly staff! The bruschetta options are awesome. Love the large patio. I just cannot get excited about their wine options. I like domestic red wines and the choices are very limited for a wine bar. I don't get it.

W0O00iKvAfXvZA253PLx9Q.text: Took my sister here on her birthday last week and had David as a server, he was wonderful and was very accommodating to me and gave me other alternatives for non-alcoholic drinks which I've always had trouble with going elsewhere. Midway through our lunch he told us they were going through a transition and we would get a new server. Our new server was Jenny. We finished our food and closed out. I tipped in cash and wrote CASH on the tip line. Upon checking my accounts, I found out she tipped herself an extra $8 on top of the other cash tip I gave her. My sister and I had a great time and it's a shame that happened. I don't feel I would be comfortable going back as I feel like I was stolen from. Only giving two stars because David was awesome and the food was great, but theft is never okay.

KkqR1phQZf-qJB8xXIVQMw.text: I really loved this place. I went here for brunch and ordered bruschetta, the prosciutto panini and the chicken mozzarella panini with a bellini drink.  The bruschetta was awesome. I had the salmon, bacon, proscuitto and something else I can't remember at the moment. Highly delicious. Especially the salmon and the proscuitto. Equally amazing were the two panini. So worth it because I was had to take some home too! Too much food.  The atmosphere was nice with lots of light during the day and the server was attentive. It's a good place to bring a date, friends or family. I'm so glad there's one in Tempe now too. I gotta go try that one!   I'm going to try going at night too and see how it feels. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken with mozzelrealla
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pruschuttonwith Brie
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta

5kwKcqk4kHcKjMSGTm2yIw.text: I came her for lunch with a couple of friends and it was our first time. Our waiter was friendly and took the time to explain some of the menu items for us. I got the select two where you can get half a panini and your side choice of soup and salad. My friends got the corn chowder soup and I got the mixed green salad with poppyseed dressing(my favorite!). We also got an order of bruschetta to share as an appetizer. I thought it was nice we could choose up to 4 different bruschetta so we could have variety. Definitely one of the best bruschetta I ever had!  The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because since it's in the downtown area, the parking lot is very small.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rmCLrwKfyx6_dQxTQNsPFg.text: Probably my favorite place to go eat at!!! Love the chicken & mozzarella sandwich!! Great customer service as well! Everybody is so hip

_3Lz1p9k7etts2-lDJ8XEQ.text: Great place! Jeff was our waiter and was excellent! He was so positive, attentive, and cheerful. He was constantly checking on us and exceeded as a water. We go to Postino often, and love this place. Its great for happy hour, and I would definitely recommend checking it out.

q-MTpnYYcPfnBoGSWlZ-Sg.text: Postino's Central is one of those places you don't visit as much as you'd like because you just don't want to ever wait (and they don't offer reservations to parties of less than eight). But this morning I felt like we'd have dodged the wait with the 115 degree weeks. That wasn't the case but the wait is a testament to how much the high summer temps doesn't faze the appreciation from their clientele. It's a neat space with inviting and friendly service (none of this hipster aura of exceptionalism). Enjoying $5 mimosas -- and they don't skimp on the bubblie-- we went to town on olives, butchers blocks, and bruschettas.  Oh, and a salad.  The rest was just details. The food was all excellent-- literally every single bite was perfect -- and, while I thought the place looked a little pricey before we were served but, once I was finished, the tab was well-earned.   There's nothing on Postino to make this work. Bygones be to your fear of waits, it's on you to go back to Postino's more often.

1VCk4RktdRwTHl9YonnMMA.text: At first, I kept away from this place because my lasting Love for Katz Deli wouldn't allow me to give this place a try from it's early get go. A friend of mine invited me to join Happy Hour with friends on a week day and I fell in love. Love their $5 glasses of wine and Pitchers of Beer from Open to 5pm Seven Days a Week!   Ro and I usually order the Select Two /$10.50 with 2 choices: Half of any Panini, Side Salad of Choice or Soup of The Moment. Postino's Central has become one of our fave date night restaurants. Oh...give the Cheese Board a try...YUMMERS! Can't go wrong with this place. Cheers***

740XPcA5LcPIzAiFB0M9Qg.text: Best restaurant ever. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The service is always attentive and fast, which is why I recommend Postino to everyone for special occasions, out of town guests or just a fun local spot. Delicious food, great service and a dog-friendly patio are why I'm here at least twice a week!

0rrH3XSVounHKpPMvdjE9w.text: Came in tonight for my friends birthday celebration tonight. Dinner, drinks, and service were great! Casandra( our server) went above and beyond tonight to clarify the "recork" policy. She questioned what we were told when we asked about finishing our bottle that was already recokered and wanted to finish. Then came back to our table with a brand new uncorked bottle.The manager Jackson came over to make sure we were taken care of. What a classy move by both of them. What True customer satisfaction is all about!! One of our favorite spots, and  will continue to be

OBQVsa2aPnRmSpCKzB9rhA.text: The Monday and Tuesday night special is what keeps me coming back again and again! The only thing I would change is having it start at 7p vs 8p, for those of us that like to try and get to bed before 10p :)  The bruschetta boards are out of this world and pairing it with a bottle of wine for $20 is a steal!!! Our go to's are the smoked salmon with pesto, sweet & spicy pepper jam with goat cheese, salami with pesto and fresh mozzarella with tomato & basil. Try them!!! You will not regret it!!

pMg75f8qMT0Fr_juvEejzQ.text: Had a salad with some sort of greens that I could barely chew unless I chewed like a cow on it for 10 min./bite. Asked for bacon added and got maybe one and a half tablespoons at the most. Not a go to place for a salad...same old problem of asking for meat on it and getting 3 ounces for $4-$5. Rather stay home.

07PhGM0lPuNe8afO7qGmMw.text: Bottom line.  Nice location to have a few drinks and light upscale pub(ish) food with friends.  Service 4/5.  Friendly and engaging, served their function by keeping drinks and food around, knowledgeable about the menu selections and parings with the beverage list.  Personality 4/5 .  This location has it's own little vibe, although you get the sense it is trying to be cool when it should just relax and be itself.  The location, ample shade, and open air concept is enough to be a nice canvas to paint a fun experience with friends without the pretentiousness.  Quality 5/5.  My group only had appetizers, and all of them were definitely a step up from what you would expect from a bar.  Being a little of a tapas fan, the (fill in the blank) boards are all great (of course that is more a function of the items they select for the boards as there isn't a ton of additional prep).  They do have a cergonia olive there that is definitely unique and tastes fantastic (oversized, taste like a cross between a black and green olive without the silly pimento).       Recommendation 4/5.  A nice spot to make your "local" go to hang out and have some drinks and light fare.

WOjvOK4XTkAVV6_-oW-7BQ.text: Postinos is a regular place for me. My partner and i were "cut off" because we seemed drunk which is unTrue because we had only had a few glasses of wine. The manager alex was very nice and polite. I own several restaurants in the area and was extremely upset with how we were treated. When my partner and I started speaking Spanish and that's when we were discriminated against. I have had great experiences at Postinos and now it's become a very racial place.

c0yh2r4NR51sR5oOasAfoQ.text: Who doesn't love Postinos? Best bruschetta I've tasted -- love the selection of toppings! I usually order prosciutto with fig and mascarpone (my favorite) salmon with pesto, bacon burrata and Brie with apples. Mhmmmm just writing this review is making my mouth water! Lol  I enjoy coming here for brunch on the weekends. I love that wine and a pitcher of beer is only $5 until 5pm daily -- what a deal!  I love this location the best out of the other ones. I like that churn is just right across the street if I wanted something sweet, although I'm not sure I would need that since postinos salted caramel ice cream is so good -- don't sleep on it!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Yk_U7oohyPYiAErwQhceLg.text: I used to live in the Phoenix area but now live back in the Bay Area, so when I came to visit a friend in Phoenix last week she was super excited to take me to some new places that have popped up/that she's discovered since I left, including Postino. I think this was one of my favorite restaurants that I tried on this trip!  We came for brunch and sat outside. The patio is great and the weather was perfect that day. The patio also appeared to be dog friendly for those like me who like to bring their dog along! For food I got a couple of small plates: the one egg with bacon (got mine over medium, and it was perfect) along with the walnut toast with brie and berry preserves (at my friends recommendation and I am SO glad I tried it!). The walnut toast was out of this world. The combo of sweet and salty was perfect. I also got a couple of the peach bellinis, which was the perfect brunch drink and something a bit different than your average brunch mimosas.  The prices are super reasonable too. It may just be because I'm from the Bay Area and everything is insanely expensive here, but the fact that both my small plates only equaled to $7 total and each drink was only $5, I was floored at how cheap my meal was. Service was friendly and very fast. I will definitely be back to try some more things including their bruschetta next time I am in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One egg over medium with bacon, walnut toast with brie and berry preserves, and a peach bellini!

lAFEEfnZ8MzjGGvhY_-aeQ.text: Thank you to Postino for sending me a gift card when I was not completely satisfied with my experience! The general manager Kara was a great help. I look forward to coming back

wcQ-02ixXWJe26-ouJQFgA.text: I'm sorry, but $5 glasses of wine 7 days a week? Umm....yes, please! Just a lovely ambiance, especially when the weather is just right and the restaurant has it's bar windows open: during the day it is fresh and lovely; at night it is cosy and romantic!  Could it get any better? YES!  Mondays and Tuesdays they have a special after 8pm that includes a bottle of wine and a bruschetta board. And the fireplace outside is perfect if you want to cuddle up! Perfect for a date or a ladies lunch! Honestly, it is an all around no brainer, because the staff are AHMAZING!  Vanessa, Slade and Michael are always on point with wine suggestions, and so sweet and kind to boot!  But the manager Kara is hands down, the best!  Always friendly and full of smiles! Cheers to Postino!  You guys are killing it!

7MooH8YvquUNniYCIsTNLQ.text: Postino Central was a fairly 'meh' dining experience on Mother's Day.  Made early reservations for the special occasion. The staff was friendly and they were good at checking in and making sure we were pleased with the food and kept our drinks full.  Well, I suppose that's about the best of what I can say. There was little on the menu that really appealed to me, but the food was pretty good. Nothing to write home about... it actually looked much better than it tasted. Though, importantly, it tasted very fresh. A bit pricey for what felt like an appetizer. I actually left feeling a bit hungry.  The worst part was that they were blasting disco so loud, no one could hear each other speak. Terrible for Mother's Day...  Overall, I can see how it might appeal to some, but I definitely won't be going back.

47_y6ysqWZ4aoiOEl9nX_g.text: Initially I went because of the reviews on here.  Unfortunately it's not particularly special as its raved on here. I had the Bruschetta of course. But for the price, it wasn't extraordinary.   The atmosphere is mildly fun and interesting. Go at night and try to go when it's cool outside and sit out, that would be your best experience there.

JOTgO9cnMNSrhujyviz8yA.text: I was in Phoenix for work and my client brought me to this delicious place for lunch.  We had to drive a bit out of our way and it was worth it!  I had the Prosciutto with Brie sandwich with a side salad.  I am finding myself craving this sandwich now that I am home.  The flavors were so perfect!  The service was outstanding as well.  Next time I will plan my trip so I can try their brunch.  I wish we had somewhere like this in Vegas!

Waited over 20 minutes to order a second round of drinks and in order to do that had to flag him down and ask if it was ok to order more. The time we were there before this we were seated and ignored for about 15 minutes before asking a manager if we would be helped.   I've gone to postino for years and the last two experiences being ignored by the server are putting a stop to that. TeD7rYaF1jSy93NZ7D1cuA.text: My fellow yelper's and I are in agreement. You won't be disappointed by partaking of the great eats, drinks and treats this establishment offers.

Bqofqs9eWwnUrpf_K2J_sQ.text: Can't go wrong with the bruschetta and wine combo. Went a few weeks back and do not regret going. Would definitely go back when I visit again in the future.

e1DLterEJNlp_xUZfFV7Og.text: This is my favorite place to go with friends for good wine and even better food! It's such a relaxed environment and even when there are quite a few people there it still seems like a relaxing fun environment. They have a really great music playlist and their customer service is also on point. I always take my friends here who haven't tried it before and they definitely love it !

xODA74-aNL1ScoDkf0zn6w.text: Great place to go with friends and chill Happy hour is phenomenal food is Delicious .    Highly recommend

9DL2NtrcfZn_YAcPhdxXLg.text: Pros: Bruschetta, gluten free Bruschetta, $20 Bruschetta and bottle of wine Mon - Tues after 8pm, Great 1/2 sandwich and soup/salad deal for lunch.  Oh, and I should mention the Bruschetta.    Cons: Valet parking on occasion, can get busy and a little loud.    There's a reason that everyone loves this place, and you will too.  Go for lunch, get a good deal on food and $5 wine and beer before 5:00pm.  Go for dinner on Mon-Tues after 8:00pm and get a bottle of wine and a selection of bruschetta for $20.  I've been more than 30 times, have eaten everything on the menu, and its all delicious.  I can't say that for any other place, including grandma's.

IMqxwzx9wLQsx34Bzd2Jsg.text: I can't stop thinking about their warm fresh baked scones!! I've dined at Postino's twice and can't wait to go back. The meals are a bit heavy on bread and leave me feeling like carb overload and need some protein... but it's a nice going out treat and I could always order more protein on the menu (I just like their bready foods!).Always recommend the bruschetta you can't go wrong with any flavor. We especially love the atmosphere here too it has a relaxing fresh outside seating area and the local birds are good entertainment.

BaKYyMjrJiNand9JEw6I1A.text: I've only been here once, but my only complaint was that my belly wasn't big enough for all of the food that I ordered. I had a sandwich, wine and a bruschetta board. Everything was good, but I'd say the bruschetta board is really the item to visit for. Different flavors and choices. Combinations that you aren't sure should work are delicious. So when I crave a girls night with the works, I intend to come here for wine and bruschetta boards!  Update... had to lower by 1 star. I've definitely been back a few times and the bruschetta is getting more dry and chewy each time. I wonder if I'm coming at the wrong hours... maybe too busy and they rush it out... not as good as the first time by a stretch.

-j9RwKOiJTJC-h6nN1PTYg.text: This place is a gem in Phoenix. I was visiting in the area with my partner and we went to this place for a brunch as its one of his favorite. This place definitely did not disappoint. Very modern place, great outdoor "homey" patio with vintage touch. Our server Danielle was very accommodating and pleasant. Thank you Postino! Will definitely come back next time.

YTl1ddE8CLX-b6KUyvM0jA.text: Wine and bruschetta specials on Monday and Tuesday rock!  Love this place! Great place for happy hour or to meet up with the gals....great for a date also!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ISgUiFkM6E0ZxV9oS5Yunw.text: Time and time again, Postino never fails to disappoint. Considered to be a wine bar, there is quite an extensive list of wines from across the country as well as internationally. If you get there before five pm, all glasses of wine and pitchers of draft beer (2 pints worth) are only $5. A pitcher is still only $7.50 after 5pm.   As far as food goes there is a simple menu that is full of delicious flavors. You can order a board of bruschetta that allows you to pick 4 different kinds, 4 pieces each for $14. My favorites include green apple and Brie with fig, prosciutto with fig and mascarpone, and tomato jam and fresh sheeps milk cheese. Always fresh tasting, always delicious.   Besides the bruschetta there are a variety of salads and paninis, which you can also do a  mix and match combo on by doing a half order of each ($9.75).   If you come after 8pm on Mondays and Tuesdays you can get a bruschetta board and a bottle of wine for $20.   I've had brunch here a few times. While it's good I prefer to go to Fez about a mile south on Central.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $5 pitchers before 5!
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch- Bellinis and bruschetta!

tnQOyow71oDG_WKB7TD7cg.text: Yes, just yes. Ambiance, food & drinks are a win any day of the week. I've not had problems with service (food has been prompt within reason depending on the amount of customers); the servers are friendly, though I wouldn't classify the service as 'amazing'.   We usually go to Postino for Sunday brunch as a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids); the wait is reasonable (20-30 min), and the food is always quality.  We also drop in on random week nights for a date night- can't go wrong with the bruschetta board!  Thank you, Postino, for taking care of your Phoenix community.

1TAohdJwer5-P8tlM9N_Ew.text: Love love love the bruschetta! Best I've had here in Arizona. If possible, go during their wine/bruschetta deal nights on Mondays and Tuesdays. You can get an order of bruschetta and bottle of wine for $20! Can't beat that! The bruschetta is more than filling. My personal favorites are the prosciutto, burrata, and salami.

68yZBUR_52LBGdrtipObXw.text: I've always gone to the location in Arcadia (which I love) but this location is amazing too! What a beautiful patio with the fireplace in the middle & the best bruchetta around. Cant beat their $20 bottle & board deal here. So wonderful!

t5mnu_DxwPEshZCnM8DFIQ.text: Amazing selection of bruschetta. Nice open patio bar with lots of veggie and gluten free options. Great lunch spot.

xuMks-XhVOPjpd95bYQqyA.text: Let me just say: red pepper/goat cheese, Brie/apples and warm artichoke bruschetta are AAAHHHHMMMAAAZZZIIIINNNNGGG! I love the vibe here too. The clientele is different than Gilbert so that is definitely refreshing. The service was excellent and the wine selections were delicious. I will definitely make a special trip up from Gilbert just to come here again soon :)

STYQlj2LZElbF9uH3IX_Rg.text: I've been to Postino many times and this location has always been a bit on the dirty side. The staff is often eating and drinking around the bar. They definitely need a new dishwasher because every time someones left overs are on my plate. I love the 5 dollar pitchers but not when it has old food particles in it and on the glass. Also way to many flys. Management needs to step it up.

frHJ_WZbVZ7jtqhiZhLM1g.text: LOVE Postino Central! The bruschetta is delicious, and the atmosphere is great too!

wmbSUBbfLnmOvoHiAbUdcA.text: The food is amazing. I love the salad with the grapes, and of course, the bruchetta.  I love the atmosphere, the music, the prices, and the service. The servers, bartenders, and manager are all oddly very good looking, which sometimes suggests a bit of snobbery, but not here, they are all fantastically friendly and good looking, so don't be fooled when you see all the sexy people. :)   Definately one of the best places one could choose to eat at when in Phoenix. Brunch is awesome too. The scone with apricot jam, don't miss that, you will keel over with delight. The cucumber honey lemonade is sweet, but pretty fantastic too.

ljHKjUDzV3uej5sG02-25Q.text: Monday & Tuesday for $20 a bottle of wine & a board of bruschetta!  What more can I say -- but don't you cry for me Ari...zo...na!!!  I'll take advantage of this special as much as I can :)  Yeah I love this place.  It's definitely a lot better than the one in Arcadia.  It's more open plus there's generally more parking space.  The service here is real good and always entertaining.  Ambience is smooth and low key.  I dig....however is there live music here or am I attending during the wrong nights? hmmm - enjoy!

6Dg8hScZzyt_Kdeb2_X60A.text: Woohoo! This is as good as it gets! I actually prefer this location to the original. They have a great covered patio. We love to introduce people to this place.   Everything here is delicious. Yes, everything. You can't go wrong with their bruschetta, but their salads and paninis are delicious as well. I love to order a half salad (raspberry chicken) and half sandwich (nine iron). They always have a great wine selection. And you know I'm going to get my wine on whenever I am here.   You absolutely must get the salted caramel sundae for dessert. DO IT. Who new chocolate covered corn nuts could be so good?

5c-MKisi0tyxG4OWMjhWAQ.text: Tried this location for the first time, and Postino delivers no matter the location.  Got the usual bruschettas, and were there for brunch so we tried the ciabatta french toast which was amazing, and the red pepper gouda soup was delicious.  Service was great and the atmosphere very warm and fun!

iXxawOCZbCrDLDwjnGI1IA.text: Happy hour at Postino rocks! And, while it's a wine bar and I DO love my wine, I dream about the pub board. I mean, where else can you find corn nuts on a restaurant menu? And the wedges of prickly, little round pickles are so tart and delicious! $5 mini pitcher of Hoegaarden washes it down perfectly.

XadpL6mXd4ID7ZU7UFMffw.text: This location is far preferable to the 'original'. Way better feel and flow of the building. Gotta love the panini and salad split :)

j-vyP_7rkWiIB0aQaAHq4A.text: I love this place. Great atmosphere in a small place and the outside seating with lift up bar window on the west edge of the bar gives the place the appearance of a roomier  joint. It is still very intimate with the candle lights flickering and shellacked wood tables.  If you are looking for a bargain, go on a Monday or Tuesday night after 8pm - close for the special "board and bottle". It is a cutting board of bruschetta (mix and match from the various offerings) and choose a bottle of red or white from a surprisingly boutiquey list of reds and whites. All for $20. Yes, $20.  This place is also without pretense as the servers don't wear any particular uniform so they look very comfy. A must try!  The regular menu is tapas heavy with some salads and sandwiches mixed in. Can't wait to visit again.

aVAllkyaa18Yt5UKqJF72A.text: I highly recommend this place!   Service was phenomenal! everyone was super friendly and gave good food recommendations!   I went here with a girlfriend, we order some bruschetta appetizers, Riesling, and I was so glad that they offer Frambroise Lambic Fruit Beer because I am not a typical "beer" fan in anyway shape or form.   Food is tasty, Drinks come in great assortment, & Vibes are slightly intimate, but very chill!

Zc5hspe0J-9cT9284wBdcA.text: This place is reliably good, both food and service!   There's a reason they are famous for their bruschetta. Smoked salmon was not my fave, but I love the apple/brie, fig/mascarpone, and ricotta dates. The staff is happy to split the salads if you are sharing with a friend- recommend the brussel sprout with manchengo cheese and crunchy/spicy almonds.   Get there before 5pm, not only for their $5 wine HH deals, but also because the place fills up.  Tip: Sign-up for their emails and they'll occasionally send out coupons for a free board. OoaWinIzBK_E0UawuGdELQ.text: Love love love Postino's. I have been to their Scottsdale location and this one and they are very consistent with their food.   Bruschetta all the way! This is the only place that I order bruschetta and I am never disappointed with the different kinds that I get.  They also have a great happy hour. That's when I usually come to get five dollar wines woot woot!  This is a great location and the staff here are pretty awesome as well. I love the patio when it is cooler outside.

nMnuvfO3HaKDCODMmmaKow.text: My absolute favorite spot in phx. I always get the prosutto and Bri panini and the bruschetta. Always satisfied. The vibe is fun and upbeat and welcoming. Great spot for a weekend eat or even a random Tuesday.

ZbOc4GxVbbRRjeAexQHDAg.text: Sometimes when it's 110 degrees out in the dog days of summer, you really want to kick back with a glass of wine and get some light fare. Postino's is great for that. They have paninis, soups, and salads, but my favorite is the bruschetta--so many flavors to choose from and they're all amazing.  I'd recommend heading down with two or three friends so you get to try even more of the options.

W6q4JpZhSQJjMYeLk50_ZA.text: Postinos is always a great experience! All the bruschettas are so good! Especially try the apple, brie and fig jam!! The wine is amazing as well; overall, I love this place!

3hmc0b0BOFZeUWXXRLNvBA.text: Postino is always a good choice for brunch/ lunch! My husband and I come pretty often and you can never go wrong. We usually split the Chx/ mozzarella sandwich and a bruschetta board. $5 wine and pitchers of beer every day until 5pm! This is such a good deal and is one of the things that keeps us coming back. Service is always amazing and everyone works really well together. David (name on ticket) this past Sunday around lunch time was great!! Super friendly and attentive. Highly recommend!

gmhkliQUuJOPigZFc_10MA.text: Only giving one star because my kids came and they have great kids menu/price. However the service was extremely slow. Waited 10 minutes to be seated 20 minutes to be served. Server never came back to ask if we needed anything. Waited 20 additional minutes for a check. Awful service, servers were all standing around talking to each other.

Fg2R3kEJ0ezM9HdeDo9Hkw.text: Absolutely fabulous - who knew bruschetta could be quite delicious? When my friend suggested Postino, I had little expectations. I know many people love bruschetta, but I usually find them (specifically, the bread) to be too hard or too soggy. A caprese salad with garlic bread would be tastier.   BUT Postino serves up extraordinary bruschetta (bruschetti?). We ordered two orders of the bruschetta + bottle of wine (what a deal! Just $20 per order after 8 PM) so we got to sample 8 of the 12 offerings in total. I love how each bruschetta was sliced into 4 so that we could share them easily.   Listed in order of faves:  (1) PROSCIUTTO WITH FIGS & MASCARPONE: Sweet and savory. The thin layer of saltiness paired wonderfully with the chewy and tang of the figs and the sweetness of the mascarpone.  (2) RICOTTA WITH DATES & PISTACHIOS: Totally unexpected and delicious. The nutty and buttery crunch of the pistachios paired with the chewy dates and the sweet ricotta = divine.  (3) SMOKED SALMON WITH PESTO: Really well balanced and tasty. (4) BRIE & APPLES WITH FIG SPREAD: The green apples were very fresh and elevated the rich brie.  (5) WARM ARTICHOKE SPREAD: Yummy! You could really taste the artichoke.  (6) BURRATA, BACON, ARUGULA & TOMATO: Tasty, and exactly like you would expect these combinations to taste like. Although the taste of the burrata was buried under the bacon. (7) ROASTED PEPPERS WITH GOAT CHEESE: Assertive goat cheese and great taste of the roasted peppers. (8) SEASONAL: We got a tomato jam one, which tasted like an elevated lunchables pizza spread. I used to have these almost everyday in middle school! Quite interesting.  If you are ordering one by yourself, I highly recommend (1) to (4) above! They are so interesting and the flavors come together to create scrumptious harmonies. Since I live across the country, I might try to recreate these flavors until I can come back and visit!

eYPLQbUmvtGTU83Rozp41w.text: I love the boards and a moscato. Can't go wrong. I get the bruschetta board and a butcher's board, I do take half of it home, but since I can't make up my mind on one I get 2. My husband loves the paninis. It's a nice place it can be a bit crowded inside, but they do have outside seating as well. I have gone with friends and enjoyed it. My husband and I have gone together and it was nice as well.

xWWcDMZA2yLBAxs8jKZVrQ.text: I really enjoyed the bruschetta board  with my favorite being the prosciutto with figs and mascarpone. The smoked salmon with pesto is also very good. The ambiance was nice for a date night, complete with fireplace outside.   Our waitress was friendly and attentive. The only reason it isn't 5 stars is I didn't care for the autostrada panini much. It was a good sized sandwich but it just wasn't very toasted as it had barely notable grill marks and the meat and cheese were cool (I got the ciabatta bread) and despite the bread being good I felt like the bread to meat ratio was off: Too much bread and not enough meat or cheese.   Either way I would definitely come back and try something other than the panini. It was a nice experience overall. The gf was happy drinking her wine :)

TDc2FUft6NR6OGWtURMNkg.text: This is my favorite place to come when I'm down in Phoenix. They have the best bruschetta I've ever had and I keep coming back because I find myself constantly craving it. Their wine selection is amazing and all the wines that I've tried have been delicious and pleasing. The service is always super nice and accommodating which I love! The atmosphere is sleek, chic and yet also warm and homey which will make you want to sit back, drink some wine (or mimosas) and have some incredible food. I highly recommend! For breakfast, brunch or a very nice dinner, this is a the place to go!

s7BdRkkb07Yf3fwKNAlbyQ.text: Friends and I went into Postinos for Bruschetta and Wine,  the wine was refreshing and crisp. The Bruschetta was delicious.   Service; our Servers were so cute and supportive of five Ladies drinking wine and laughing. The Servers want to make you come back again and again.

IRbyQRYG25_Ioj4v-SdQSg.text: It was a cold day so I ordered  French onion soup. And asked that it served  nuclear  hot . There was no cheese on the top of the onions and the broth was not very rich. I was expecting  a nice beef broth . They did put a piece on  cheese bread . The order took about 30 minutes  even though  they were not busy . I also had the sandwich with  brie but the brie was not light and fluffy.  Normally  I am very satisfied with the restaurant.  . Out lunch took 75 minutes  which was disappointing  and the food marginal

Ne0bSpPfl6-r1Hztl9fAoQ.text: Wow...great Happy Hour wine and beer.  Tried the chicken white bean green chili soup..pretty darn tasty.  Their bread is really good!! Jason our Bartender/server was super friendly..knowledgeable and fun!! Good times on a Sunday Funday!!

5cxcNcLVXqdUlQhz89lFtA.text: Llooovveee!!!!! Monday-Tuesday 4 bruschetta and a bottle of wine for 20$.... Ya can't beat that. The staff is very attentive and takes that extra step to make ya feel at home... My number 1 go spot for girls or date night.. plus they recork what ya don't finish(I always finish lol)... this place has my Heart!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You can&#39;t beat this
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmmmm

6NK_yZbY8cSwHWd7OqhNhg.text: Bruschetta.  How exciting is it really?  I have had it as an appetizer at many restaurants and I have made it at home.  Grilled bread with garlic and tomatoes, basil, olive oil and salt generally.  Well, the Postino restaurants have taken it to a completely different level.  It is, what I assume this chain of restaurants in AZ, is known for as there are pictures of their bruschetta boards everywhere.  And rightfully so.  Postino's bruschetta is unlike any bruschetta I have ever experienced.    On a recent visit to AZ, I made plans with my lovely friend, Karen W, to meet up in Phoenix at Postino Central.  This is one of two locations in Phoenix.  There are a total of seven Postino restaurants in AZ.  I was glad Karen researched this as this location is Phoenix has a parking lot behind it and on this very warm summer day, we decided to meet up when it opened for lunch at 11 a.m. and were able to find parking in this lot.  There is an outdoor patio, but as the weather was over 100 degrees already, all patrons were choosing to sit inside.  The restaurant has a bar at the back with seating and a community table next to it.  The rest of the dining area is comprised of a few booths and mostly table and chairs.  The hostess who seated us was war and inviting and welcomed us to the restaurant.    Our server was really nice and told us a bit about the menu.  My friend and I knew right away that we wanted to sample the famous bruschetta.  The board is comprised of four choices of bruschetta.  There are 12 types to choose from with one selection being seasonal.  It was hard to choose just four as they all sounded fantastic. We finally decided on the Warm Artichoke Spread, Prosciutto with Figs and Mascarpone, and Burraat, Bacon, Arugula and Tomato.  We were undecided on our fourth and final choice.   I asked our server what his favorite bruschetta was and he said the Sweet & Spicy Pepper Jam with Goat Cheese.  We went with that as our fourth. Words cannot express how much I LOVED this bruschetta.  It was a sight to behold.   It was almost too beautiful to eat, almost ;)  First off, it is on thick slices of untoasted bread.  The four selections we picked were all fantastic but I would have to say, hands down, that the  Burrata, Bacon, Arugula and Tomato and the Warm Artichoke Spread were my favorites.  I am a sucker for Burrata cheese as it is one of my favorites and with the savory goodness of the bacon and combined with the arugula and tomato this was a winner in my book.  The Warm Artichoke spread was absolutely delicious, too.  I loved the creamy, flavorful goodness of this one.  In the future, I would seriously order two boards just to sample eight types of their bruschetta.   I also ordered a Butcher's Block, but it was kinda noisy in the restaurant as it was quite crowded on this weekday, and I think I distracted our server by asking him about his favorite bruschetta.   This was overlooked on our order but I ordered it again after we polished off the bruschetta.  The Butcher's Block was gorgeous.  That is one thing with dishes here is presentation is just beautiful, but the food tastes good too.  A board of artisan meats and cheese and hummus, nuts, olives and toast points.  It was very good.  I also ordered a Honey Cucumber Lemonade as my beverage.  I am a huge fan of cucumber and this was so refreshingly good on this very warm day.  I ordered a second.  There are no free refills on this drink.  They have an awesome selection of wine and other adult beverages here, but we opted to not imbibe this lunch.  The staff at Postino Central were all friendly, attentive and helpful.  Our glasses of water were kept filled which we appreciated, also.  I cannot say enough about this restaurant.  For a chain of seven restaurants, I was surely impressed with this location and wouldn't mind making my way to each of the other six locations in the future :)

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta-Warm Artichoke Spread,Prosciutto w/Figs &amp; Mascarpone, Burrata, Bacon,Arugula &amp;Tomato,Sweet &amp; Spicy Pepper Jam w/Goat Cheese.Yum!
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Butcher&#39;s Block. Tasty stuff :)
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ;)

GDVKEjQcAJajWqAUPCfNCw.text: Can't believe this is my first time posting about postino... looooooove this place!   The bruschetta is a must have. They have a bunch of different ones to choose from with a wide variety of fancy meats, cheeses, and spreads. Warm artichoke spread is for sure my favorite. They even offer gluten free bread! They also have a seasonal one so be sure to ask your server about that too.   Normally you can get a board and choose 4 for $15 but if you go after 8pm on Monday or Tuesday you can get a bruschetta board and a bottle of wine for $20! Such a good deal.   Also, be prepared for a wait. This place is always poppin'

XdrYSCMKYBG57BiODdT5hg.text: Great service great food I came here with my girlfriend and we were seated very quickly. I highly recommend the Butcher's Block and the bruschetta that they are known for!

xv7hq8ULvS0u-cOlRNO85g.text: Postinos a spot for high rollin' winos.   You woke up at noon and had breakfast during lunchtime, so the next logical step is to have lunch food during dinner time, with some wine. This is where postino's comes in.   The menu is full of salads, Paninis, bruschetta and a few apps. There is a large by the glass wine menu ($8-$14) and hipster cool ambiance.   Service here is great, the patio is quite nice with heaters, a fire place and even a few patio furniture loungers.  Great for a date, hanging with friends and conversation.  We started with the Bella Postino $9 Crustini with a artichoke dip and a hummus. The artichoke dip was great as any fat laden dip would be. The humus was ok but I am a hummus  snob.  For our main we had the Vegetarian Panini ($9.75) It was good and moist with hummus roasted tomatoes olives and an artichoke spread, the focaccia bread was well toasted from the Panini press.  We also had the mediterranean  salad 8.75 which is a romaine salad with copious amounts of feta. Pretty good as I do like cheese but maybe not as healthy as one would want from a salad.  For desert we had a crem burle, simple not to sweet and well executed a classic.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7RkhQE2HUcv7qQ3GVfQM3Q.text: I am so happy that my friend chose this place for us to meet and catch up. The weather was nice so we sat outside and I thought it was very beautifully lit. There were also a few fireplaces going. We had amazing service the entire time we were there and the staff was very attentive. I ordered bellinis to drink and they were delicious with a great peachy flavor that was very strong but not overpowering or overly sweet. We decided to split the mix greens salad and two orders of the bruschetta. For the bruschetta, we picked the brie and apples, prosciutto  with fig, warm artichoke, buratta bacon arugala, ricotta with dates, and smoked salmon with pesto. I honestly loved every bite of everything I ate here. Everything was well thought out to make sure each bite was splendid. I loved how each bruschetta had textural and flavor contrasts. The salad was also very delicious.  The pears and grapes were perfectly crisp and fresh. The candied pecans were a nice touch to the salad. The poppyseed vinaigrette was super tasty and very light. I loved it! I loved it here so much I went the following day to the annex location to have brunch!! No shame. If you haven't been here before, go. You are missing out!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. For your gum.. with the sugar packets
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

c1muMW31Tdwer55Ki9_98g.text: I'm just realizing that I have WAY too many 5 star reviews but maybe it's just because I go to some amazing places.  This is one of those places.    To save whoever is reading this to consider going or not....  just go. Now.  You might want to consider making a reservation.  Stop reading this.  Run.    I effing love this place.  They do bruschetta like no one else does and their service and drinks are awesome too.  They are the rare triple threat- like if this restaurant were your girlfriend that you've been dating for only 6 months your mom would love her and all of your buddies would tell you to "lock it down".  Seriously that good.   My favorite bruschetta are the apple and brie and the "classic" tomato and mozzarella.  I generally get a pino grigio (house) or pino nior (house) depending on my mood.  I really need to try more of their menu but their bruschetta is so freaking good that I never get past it.    The normal every day deal is $14 for 4 different types of bruschetta.  It's a pretty big order- each bruschetta is about 4-5 inches long and it's cut into roughly 1 inch pieces so it's sharable and not messy.  I personally can fill up on just that but if you've got 3 people with bigger appetites you might want to order 2 orders.    You might want to consider making a reservation or be prepared to wait- in the evenings they get packed.    I moved from Phoenix to Reno this past year and this is the number 1 place I miss the most.  If they ever want to consider opening up a place here we have a superb foodie community and I know they would be welcome.    GO TO THIS PLACE NOW.

ypoi45j4G4bIrM8cYtOnLQ.text: Wonderful Sunday brunch specials, service was friendly but a little slow though. Took 10 minutes for our server to take our drink order, and another 10 for him to deliver it. Then had to wait another 15 to get our food order taken. Then our food came and we had to ask a couple times for silverware, and that took another 5-10 minutes to get. The bruschetta boards were delicious but a little too oily for me.  Overall a good first experience except the slow service. They weren't crazy busy but they may have been understaffed or something. I would go back and try it out again.

xq1GXiwwhOyrXPfdshDAVA.text: My go-to place.  Casual and Friendly.  Always consistent.  Food and wine are amazing.  Great prices before 5pm.

CRApKEZuVV1SG-DaQ9j3tg.text: My last review was removed because it wasnt detailed enough, so here goes. The restaurant was crawling with gnats, flying gnats, all around the bar, around the table, in our glasses.  There were also a large amount of flies in the restaurant.  While I do understand it is an open patio, flies would have been reasonable,  however gnats covering the walls by the restrooms is not. While eating, my.mother noticed something large moving behide the bar and back door to the patio,  it was a mouse, that ran outside into a shed of sorts. Again, i understand there will be some elements of nature that this type of restaurant will endure, this however,  crosses all lines of cleanliness. Grab a towel, some hot water and bleach and CLEAN this place up.

kyMsa1jxNnQDu17XGjm5dA.text: AMAZING.   had a bruschetta board.  chose: salami + pesto, prosciutto + figs, apples + Brie, mozzarella + tomatoes.   prosciutto is perfect! it's not like those ones that's are super ham-y tasting. it was authentic and amazing.   my sister said she would bathe in the pesto sauce.   sat the bar with our backs to the patio. perfect setting, usually don't like sitting at bars but it's comfortable.   servers at bar were superrrr nice. and didn't judge us when we asked to order another board. so that's a plus.  had the red blend wine. so delicious. also had a mimosa, at $5 it can't be beat.   this is a perfect place, I will be back. maybe tomorrow.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SSUjR28ABSqh0YyLe8qQFg.text: So pleasantly surprised by how amazing Postino is. Came here on a Monday and was able to take advantage of their $20 bottle of wine + 4 bruschetta deal. Not a single complaint! I got the pepper jelly and goat cheese, burrata bacon and tomato, artichoke spread, and apple fig Brie bruschettas- they were all mouth watering! Major bonus points to Postino for corking unfinished bottles so you can bring them home, too. I will definitely be back!!

12ieLsAqKrmxZLACAXT4oA.text: BRUSCHETTA! The three of us got 4 to share: Smoked Salmon with Pesto, Burrata Bacon Arugula & Tomato, Salami with Pesto, and Brie & Apples with Fig Spread. Oh my goodness. I loved the presentation, so elegant and gorgeous. The flavors melted together in my mouth in harmony.   I got the Hannah's Field salad as my entree, which had amazing textures and complementary flavors. Definitely recommend if you're not feeling a full meal.   My cousin and his boyfriend seem to frequent this place, and I can definitely understand why. The ambiance on a Friday night was trendy, with clientele in their mid 20s- 40s. Classy without being snooty. Intimate without the claustrophobia. It's definitely a place you go to for both the food and the environment. The whole package is a winner and I only wish I lived closer to Postino!

cobajhQQPvnfjWv3J-uIXw.text: I had dinner with my girls on a Monday for the $20 bruschetta and wine. The ambiance speaks for itself, the food is absolutely delicious. But. Let me just say this, Michael Rhodes is amazing! The two times I've been to this location, I've been blessed to get this awesome spirit both times to wait on me. He was well versed in his wines, recommended great selections from the menu, and wore a smile like no other. Thank you for your great service and food!

rnRZyjJdinUPxmW_lh8D3w.text: Great Tuesday night specials -- 4 diff bruschetta and a bottle of house wine for $20 !!!   Some of the best bruschetta here are the following: prosciutto/fig and apple/Brie for the sweeter choices, and salmon/pesto for more savory option.   Their raspberry chicken salad is also bomb!   Great music most of the time but can be noisy if you want to come for a date and actually hear the other person.

JMfFUsTVB28t4Lnct3EapQ.text: I love Postino! I make it a point to go often and take out of town guests there. The food is awesome and I especially like their $20 board & wine deal.

B_pzkAvW-dymLZ3sTVNLig.text: This is our favorite of Arizona. We have stopped both times that we've come and still think about it even once we've left. I want some right now. Bruschetta Bruschetta Bruschetta....*salivates* $5 wine glasses....$14 for 4 pieces of large Bruschetta....you're all set. Order any of it and you won't regret it. That's it.

gHQYsxhmpZRINaG2TFH1LA.text: 15 dollars for bruschetta and something ridiculous for sandwiches would seem like a reason for lowering my review BUT the flavors are truly unique! I have never had anything like it before or since and for that reason my review is so high. Otherwise it's your run of the mill hipster place with crap you can't pronounce on the menu and servers that seem to cool fir their shoes.

wDiKrnTE-34YF8T-fcuxeg.text: Really cool spot, especially the outdoor patio. The food was pretty mediocre, but the wine selection was great!

DDrsGR02awdzbYT4kJfcuA.text: Very nice looking place both outdoor and indoor. Had the nine iron which is bacon turkey and veggies. It was delicious along with the honey cucumber lemonade. People dress well here. It's not so much for dinner but more for a social place to drink wine.

msRNG3eKccAkco2su8YJHg.text: This place needs to have a 5 star rating. They have the most amazing bruschetta I've ever tasted and on Monday and Tuesday nights, you cannot beat their deal of $20 for a bottle of wine and bruschetta. The atmosphere is super fun and it had a great outdoor area. It gets packed here on Monday and Tuesdays but it is worth the wait!

QMprfehxTlgBObYP0cdm-A.text: Pros- the bruschetta is basically food porn.  It's just beautiful, it tastes beautiful and I haven't found any that can compare.  Cons- I hate it when the music is so loud.

umQNFCbx1hhRfYlLPJeGIA.text: I came for Sunday brunch and only had 1 thing, their Country Toast. It's stupid good. I really was amazed at how dang good this thing is. The bread is quality bread that's light and crispy which really made all the difference in the world. The eggs, ham and gruyere on top was cooked perfectly. They also serve it with cherry tomatoes on the side and most of them are green cherry tomatoes which really was a perfect compliment to this dish. I really was impressed. Wanted a mimosa but was still a little dehydrated from the beer from the night prior. Will definitely have to come back and eat/drink more vittles here.

UNLFE7tLlEwX6bRNMJzHCg.text: Totally love this place. Visited it on a Friday after work with my parents, brother, and boyfriend. We were greeted warmly and quickly, put on the wait list and escorted to the outdoor patio which was busy. As we waited, my Mom, bro and myself shared a delicious and refreshing bottle of a white blend wine. I'm not a huge fan of whites but on a hot afternoon, it was fantastic. We weren't even finished with our first glasses and we were seated at a nice little table near the front windows. Although it was a little tight for 5 people, a bottle (and ice tub) of wine, and then tons of food to follow; our waitress made it comfortable and kept us all happy! It was great!  To start we shared the pub board and a plate of some of the delicious bruschetta; brie with apples and fig spread, warm artichoke spread, white bean and chopped tomato, and the fresh mozzarella,tomato and basil. The pretzels were mouth watering, buttery and salty. A Sierra Nevada mustard came along with and was just spicy enough. All of the bruschetta was delicious but the apple and fig, as well as the white bean and tomato both stood out. Different ideas and tasty unique flavors together. Great combinations!  For our main course, we shared some sandwiches; my brother and Mother had the Tuna, while my boyfriend and I had the prosciutto with brie. This also had the fig on it and I couldn't get enough of it! My Pops had the raspberry chicken salad, which was also delicious.   We didn't have dessert but we did have a bottle of the wine on tap. It was a white (once again, not a huge drinker of white, so I'm not sure what kind) that was again, delicious. It was very crisp, had some bubble to it and wasn't too heavy on the honey flavor; what I deam my theory on white wines (they all taste a bit like honey).  Although I've never visited the original in Arcadia, I will definitely head back here in the future (especially because I work south of Camelback on Central!!! Thanks Postinos!

gktgz7Y6rwVYcJee-kiXRw.text: Good. Young. Professional. Go on a Tuesday.

m61Fa2v6yamgZaOn1_Tpbw.text: Despite delicious food and an impressive wine list, it hurts my heart to say that this place isn't worth the trouble. The staff is pretentious and unaccommodating. I have been here a handful of times and every server I have had has an excuse of why they cannot meet my requests. I understand a policy of not splitting checks, but then please let us know that when you are taking our order. One of the servers also told me that they cannot seat parties of five without a reservation. I understand having to wait for a table, but the place was just opening and nearly empty at the time. The menu also gives very vague descriptions making it nearly impossible for anyone with specific food allergies. I love my wine, but I am pretty comfortable with the fact that I will never go to this place again.

U4vCxq2iW3mStn0eRGMlQw.text: This was the absolute epitome of perfect date night spot! We heard about it from a good friend, and boy was she right! Get the bruscetta to share ($14) and it's a meal! You absolutely MUST have the brie, apple, and fig sauce bruscetta! You will literally be licking the board, it is just so delicious!   I am not usually one for wine bars (I don't drink wine, but my boyfriend does) and the wine was almost expensive per glass as the food, but he said it was worth it. If you are prepared to spend $9+ a glass, then it's worth every cent. It's not much from the outside, which actually almost deterred us, but don't turn back! It's dark and romantic, but also edgy and hipster-ish.   They have $20 bruscetta and bottle of wine nights on Monday and Tuesday after close, and I cannot wait to go back. I live in Mesa, but it's worth the drive all the way to Phoenix!

wu4t_jOmswNgIlQe_ELkEg.text: The 4 bruschetta for 14 $ makes my day, along with the great wine prices daily!

s15pGN-lEfCOA5vStD9rOg.text: Seriously one of the best spots for wine and wine foods. Been here at least a handful of times since they opened earlier this year and i've had everything from brunch to apps to lunch, dinner and dessert. The staff all knows their stuff when it comes to the wines, so they can always find you something you'll love (had the Grayson Cab recently, 2 thumbs up!).  The bruschetta is fool-proof. My faves are the Roasted Red Pepper w/goat cheese and the Tomato Jam w/sheep's milk cheese. The Warm Artichoke and the Brie w/Apples are a very close second. Go a bunch of times and try them all. You won't be disappointed. If you do the Mon-Tues board & bottle, its like getting the board for free! Why not!?  Paninis and salads are good.  I've had the B.E.L.T. from the brunch menu and sampled the bf's Ciabatta French Toast... both delish! On most recent visit tried the Mozz & Tomatoes Jr and i might be hooked. I had to create my own at home!  The Salted Caramel Sundae is by far their best dessert. Vanilla ice cream w/ choc-covered corn nuts and a pretzel rod, served with a big shot of salted caramel to pour over as you eat it... Soooo goood!!! Join their club online to get a free bruschetta board too!

Wo_taDwELIg0rA3ZyHsF5A.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE Postinos! The food is awesome! The wine is fabulous and the service is great! If you are unsure which wine you would like to try, ask the staff for their recommendation. They have always suggested amazing wines. This is by far one of my favorite happy hour places!

lZJN3KB45Wljp6K1xXo-PQ.text: I was here...  you guessed it.. Saturday night. I have been drooling/dreaming about/over the pictures of their cheese plates and bruschetta since frequenting yelp. Every weekend I would put off going swearing I would get there next time. I finally made it and was absolutely not disappointed.  I tend to stay away from super trendy places as my cheat meals generally include at least two places and a small time window. The wait is usually really long and although the service is usually good the food wait time is usually up there.  I came fully prepared to wait for a while and for mediocre to bad service based on the reviews I've read. I was pleasantly surprised on both topics. We were instantly greeted at the door by a very nice/enthusiastic hostess. She apologized that they couldn't seat us right away and helped us find a comfortable place to stand and wait for a table. The wait was about 15-20 minutes. Fearing the service I had read about I was keeping an eye for open tables. One opened and the hostess quickly cleared it and was showing us to our seat within a few moments of the table freeing up.  Our waitress was at our table asking about drinks within 2 minutes of sitting down. We ordered and drinks and appetizers right away. One of the apps hit the table within 5 minutes. The only complaint I have is that it was another 5 before the rest came out. Better to serve it all at once.  In summary the service was GREAT. Total opposite of what I prepared myself for.  Onto the Food:  "The Plate": An assortment of artisan meats and cheeses served with tuscan beans, olives, nuts and crostini. Absolutely delicious. There was a huge variety of olives.
