I can feel the velvety red wine at the back of my mouth and drizzling down my throat.    Parking is a bit of a hassle, but they have valet for a reason.  If you're stuck waiting for a table, squeeze in at the bar and grab a glass of wine (or three).  People watching is almost as fun here as eating.    Now that there is a Postino in the East Valley, I am hoping Postino Central will get a little less busy... if only to serve my selfish purposes.  I love everything about this place and I hope to be back soon.

ZdOhWGrGVjgb_Idh0ZDatw.text: This place rocks. I enjoy this location even more than the other. Yeah, parking sucks but the secret is come early. We arrived around 6:30 and were seated right away, had no problem parking and service was fast.   I tried the Soup of the Moment, which was a tomato based soup with a cheesy bite. It was delicious.   We also ordered the brushetta. Their brushetta is the number one reason I frequent Postinos regularly. As far as the brushetta goes, you can't really go wrong. I've tried everything and have loved them all. The newest one on the menu is a sheep's milk cheese with tomato jam. It is probably my 2nd favorite. The prosciutto with figs & mascarpone is my number 1.   If your looking for a hip, fun and delicious wine bar/restaurant your search is over.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0r33RftnCAd0d6VAiYmSFQ.text: Came here on Sunday morning/afternoon for brunch with my sisters. My first complaint was that the vallet boys were kind of pushy. The paring lot is so damn small and it's not necessary to vallet. Plus they rolled down both my windows... my passenger side window is broken and doesn't roll back up. So naturally I didn't tip him because I knew I'd be driving around Phoenix for days with my window stuck down.  Anyway! Love the atmosphere and the live band, I mean, come on. ho has a live band at a Sunday brunch, that's awesome! The wait staff seemed a bit hungover or tired or just disinterested because our waitress wasn't the most pleasant woman I'v ever met. None the less, the food was unbelievable.   Second compliment (I know my reviews seems to have a lot of complaints but I'm rating them high because the food is bomb) was that our waitress was quite displeased to have to split the check and Postinos jacks up the gratuity and then splits it evenly. So even if you ordered a small plate SOMEHOW you end up paying the same amount as the person who ordered the smoked salmon. That was kind of annoying.

4P4ugbUijSHGF84rZHUcIQ.text: Often I don't write a review for a place that has so many reviews. What's mine matter right? But, I went here a couple months ago and this place left a lasting impression.   You see I love salad and all, but typically refuse to order it at a restaurant, unless it's a side, but the Mixed Greens salad is so delicious. It's perfectly balanced. In fact, it's so good I duplicated it at home, because I loved it so much.   The bartenders were really sweet and really cute, and the service in general was awesomeness starting with the hostess on down. I also tried a sandwich and had a nice piece of cheese with some honey for dessert.  Everything was great and it made it worth the wait, because you will have to wait for a seat most likely.

ELA-iwH8bK-Od9Qi1dQLnQ.text: The food is fair. Good bruschetta. But seriously, would it kill them to get slightly comfortable chairs? The outside bar chairs are especially bad. If it is going to take me an hour to get what is essentially just a sandwich, it would be nice to not be in pain from how uncomfortable the chairs inside and outside are. I'm sure the food would also be better if it didn't come out cold. The music is way too loud.  For me, its not worth the wait or the discomfort. I am also not a huge fan of using a bathroom with a urinal next to the sink.

313ZHCcv0I4LbSqxiJFoGg.text: Postino is where it's at. Great service! Great food! The bruschetta is my all time favorite  They did a great job building such a great team of employees. Do yourself a favor and see for yourself

QMbjkcA65AZuAFZw7hgzew.text: Love this place. Great food! Great environment! The bruschetta is to die for... Tomato jam and sheep milk cheese is my favorite as well as the smoked salmon with pesto!

LePAK_qxZic7kq-X7Zea-Q.text: Only eaten here once, and I don't give five star ratings until I've at least sampled a good amount of the menu. That being said, what I DID eat was fantastic.  Service seems to be the object of concentration in Postino Central reviews. My experience was about as good as it could get, short of having a hot male waiter. We had a reservation, so the wait was non-existent. I did notice three groups of people waiting... make reservations, people, if you wanna avoid a wait!   The hostess and waiter were very friendly and attentive. The waiter was very knowledgeable and recommended some excellent wine pairings. We actually DIDN'T have the bruschetta, which I'm kind of regretting seeing how beloved it is (next time, Postino C., next time!), but the sandwich and soup combo I had was superb. I think it was the chicken with sun dried tomato pesto and corn chowder.  Didn't have to deal with the valet since one of us had a relative who lived just up the street, so we parked there and enjoyed an evening stroll. Hey, it's good for digestion.

xszMZDGZry72Iqch4umHSA.text: I don't think much more can be said that hasn't already been said about this place. Hands down my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. I was sad to move from the desert solely because I couldn't come here every week.   The bruschetta is amazing. Tomato jam is hands down my favorite...sounds weird, but extremely good. You really can't go wrong with any of them. If you go on Monday or Tuesday night after 8pm, a bottle of wine and board of this gloriousness is only $20 bucks. Get on that. If you're not in the mood for bruschetta, the Tuna Melt is out of this world...order it with a side of Sierra Nevada mustard and you won't go wrong.   The brunch here on the weekends is incredible, too. Central is the only one that offers it so don't try going to the other ones and ordering the BELT sandwich, because you won't get it....but come here and you'll experience the fantastic brunch  Free valet, too.

g31drqBxhU_TB6wOv4_VzQ.text: This place is great! I love the Mixed Greens. I order it at least once a week.

rGBWpxUkyUqBrSnneK3JOA.text: Met friends Sunday for brunch. What a cozy place. Great lighting and seating. Mimosas were on top. The meal was very light and filling. Chef Nicole took time out to share with us the flavor choices in pairing the dishes. We were very impressed at the quality of professionalism and knowledge of Chef Nicole.

XfYQaIi56GbISz6g76lPTg.text: Simply perfection! Postino's has it all figured out. This month's foodie adventure brought 14 of us to this wonderful establishment. What seems like a short menu was brilliantly prepared with quality ingredients! The bruschetta was at the top of the list; regardless of which 4 you chose, not one fell short of amazing. Both the Butcher's Block and Pub Board had an amazing selection of flavors. If I had to pick, the pretzels with sweet honey mustard, white cheddar and Schreiner's Chorizo were at the top of my list. Everything paired perfectly with my Tempranillo from Spain! We didn't have the Panini's but they did looks delicious and very large like a 5" square. We had a fantastic time and look forward to our next visit to make our way through what we originally thought was a short menu. We can't wait for the other 2 stores to open; which will make it 6 stores in total. Keep up the excellent work and keep on rocking!!

wGAdObcz7triKZBFYJaXuw.text: This is my absolute new favorite restaurant! Everyone needs to try this place at least once. I love the outside patio. The service is always good. The wine deals are great. And the food... oh man... definitely the best part! Portions are big so be prepared to share.   Be prepared with cash to tip the valet though. Not a lot of other parking. Awesome place.

B55E4J9CtoDUHcGgzFfk9Q.text: My "soup of the moment" really was. Asked for vegetarian cheese and something, got (chicken and) fajoul.   Great soup :)  With meat :(   The chicken was already dead though and I hate waste. So, you know.

HnSxURiJZwswLek3JkF4_w.text: Have been to Postino's now three times and I must say the food consistently lives up to expectations as does the wine.  I love the Midtown location as the beautiful bar opens up to a great patio.    The first two times we went, the staff was very helpful and friendly and the music was light jazz - very relaxing.   I would love to have given this  restaurant 5 stars but  i need to give it a 4 star rating because of what transpired during my third visit.   The third time was lunch with co-workers and the music was very grating and loud (Rap/grunge -which is not my cupof tea, especially when trying to have a converstion) .  When we asked our server if the music could be turned down or perhaps changed to someting less frenzied, she replied.  "No - I don't have any control over the music and I haven't received complaints from other customers."   Needless to say we weren't too happy with her response but we did not want to make a scene  nor let this ruin our lunch .  She was pretty cold towards us after my request which, unfortunately for her,  affected her tip.    That aside, whatever you order here, bruschetta, sandwiches, salads - everything is delicious and in good -size portions.  I will be back - just next time I hope the music  is  a bit more relaxing and the server with the negative attitude is not there.

DdWa2lc8vGUdSv8M0Wltcw.text: One of my favourite spots to eat, and it's even better on a Monday or Tuesday night when you get a board of bruschetta and a bottle of wine for $20. That may seem like a lot at first, but considering their bottles of wine alone are usually $20+ it's a hell of a deal. Their bruschetta is amazing! I don't know that I've had one that I didn't like. The fig and marscapone is a favourite, as is the smoked salmon, but they're all fantastic. And no tiny, hard pieces of bread here. Big pieces of crust bread smothered in whichever flavour you want and a board comes with 4 pieces, which is always more than enough for the two of us. For dessert, try their salted caramel sundae. It's ridiculous! The ice cream is smooth and perfectly creamy, the salted caramel sauce comes on the side in a tall shot glass, and the whole thing is garnished with chocolate covered corn nuts. No, really. And they're great! (and this is coming from someone who doesn't like corn nuts... at all!)   The patio is really dog friendly, the staff is usually very attentive, though service can be a little sluggish on Mondays and Tuesday, simply because they're usually so busy. If you go on either of those nights, be prepared for a wait, but it's usually not too bad. The ambiance is great and it's a perfect date place.

O4k-SVq4a9B0ysFu8Wd-cw.text: We visited this establishment for our 13th wedding anniversary and we were not disappointed!  Very relaxed atmosphere.  We sat outside and there were no smokers!! They do not allow smoking on the patio - smokers can go around the side of the building to partake.  Great wine list, also has beer and pop.  No mixed drinks.  Light food menu.  We ordered off the appetizers and it was more than enough and had the Salted Caramel sundae for dessert.  If you get there before 5:00 p.m wine by the glass is $5.00 and pitchers of beer for $5.00 - not a bad deal.  Very nice staff and free valet parking.  We'll definitely return - a very nice alternative to the chain restaurants that seem to have overtaken Phoenix.

YYtkQwhYwlFel5RdAhcCfg.text: We went here on a Friday night so it was understandable that parking was a bit tough. The wait was a bit on the long side but they made sure that we had glasses of wine while we waited. Their wine reco's were pretty good and have a great list of wines by the glass.  They also sell a good variety of wines by the bottle in their shop.  We had an assortment of their bruscettas -- so very creative and all were delightful. I couldn't pick a fav but I must admit I loved the one with the marscapone cheese. The hard part was choosing what to order. I also had a salad/panini combo -which was so fantastic.

NjxrLrqrwrT3cXpB1s0FSA.text: Fabulous service...... Great place for a girlfriends night out!

Xu0gFaytnDhMYZAFFV6yxg.text: Never did I expect a little place on Central to be so busy on a Wednesday night, so much so that they offered Valet parking because the lots were full.  I had an enjoyable time sitting on the patio.  Definitely need to go back to try their wine selection since I could not partake last night.  I only had time and an appetite for something small so I chose the Bella Postino.  Warm artichoke spread, white bean hummus and MJ Breads.  The spreads were tasty, the bread not so much.  I imagine the bread would have been heavenly (after all it is MJ's!) if it had been fresh and soft, but alas it was day old and crispy.  Not a big fan of crispy bread.  Perhaps next time I'll make mention and have the bread subbed out with soft fresh bread.  Looking forward to visiting again and trying some other items and wine !

wWgNCGo0N55tq3AdYPgm6A.text: Stars are for the ambience, really nice urban vibe, always busy so adds to the energy, the bruschetta is decent, not as magical as others have described , but a nice place to meet up with friends for a glass of wine.

epx3dxrgHxXA6tA_7tTtWA.text: Great happy hour spot with a young professional crowd. Free valet parking. Bruschetta is their best menu item. Lots of wine and full bar to choose from. I didn't take stars away, but they definitely wanted us to pay and leave after like an hour. No wine sipping here. They wanted us out and the table ready for the next person. There was a sizable line forming.

Y3akJJC5lLZQuNKnSxqQiw.text: I really loved the food.  I want to give only 4 1/2 stars due to the horrible parking.  I hate that I'm forced to use valet parking because there is no other parking available.  But the atmosphere and food was a lot of fun.

_0zs8wF4oQEiilgcy6XuRQ.text: Bruschetta=love. I can never remember which ones I had last time, but I always end up with a delicious board. I'm not a big wine guy, so the decent beer list makes me happy!

eaMKvFiCbIONQrPnYcXh2Q.text: I've been to Postinos in Arcadia several times and I always seem to forget how wonderful the food is. Last night was my first time at the Central location. I loved the atmosphere. It was comfortable, elegant and was a great space to hang out with hipsters. We ordered our usual Bruchetta and the mediterranean  salad. The salad was so amazing , I wish I new how to make the dressing.  I have had every Bruchetta they make and there isn't one I don't like. I hope it isn't too long before we go back again. It amazing how something so simple can taste so amazing.

eqhbZn4ArEJF7SPnc53XGQ.text: I've been here twice. Once for brunch and once for late night type stuff.   As most of the reviews state the food is good. I feel the portions are great. I think the overwhelming cheese plate could use more bread.  The service is friendly and reminiscent of going over to a friend's house. A friend that charges you for the food you've eaten.

FzXdfs2TruxG1imgZyZu3g.text: Great ambiance.  Has a nice large patio area.  Their bruschettas are delicious.  Paninis are great - even their vegetarian one is delicious.  Portions are a good size.  Wine selection is superb.  Great place to grab a drink and dinner after work.  Much larger than their Arcadia location but with the same great atmosphere.

98NtJReuPkjWkU3ufezvHA.text: We went here for the Slow Food Phoenix wine tasting with Eric Glomski from Arizona Stronghold/Paige Springs Vineyards.  The food they served with the wine tasting was insane.  It was fig, apple and brie bruschetta, and the most gorgeous local tomato, basil and pomegranate salad.  Anyway, after the wine tasting, we got a table and ordered their 20 dollar bottle and bruschetta special, which is a selection of 4 bruschettas and a bottle of anything on the menu.   First of all its a smokin deal, and the bruschetta is great, and there are like, 10 to choose from.  I highly recommend it!

CUCQDp6Pdd_Xb98g-3fsqA.text: Great happy hour deal on the wine and beer!  But I was a little concerned that the beer selection was somewhat haphazard compared to the care that the restaurant has placed elsewhere in the menu.  At Catherine's urging, I went for my first bite of Postino's signature bruschetta selection last Saturday with a couple of friends.  All I can say is that it was yummy and a huge improvement in positioning from what I recall of my last visit to their Arcadia location (a couple years ago).  I remember previously thinking that Postino was little more than an average but trendy neighborhood spot.  This time around, my only recommendation besides improving the beer menu (only one local brew!) is that they perhaps drop the price of the bruschetta by about $3-$5.  For afternoon snacks and drinks, I thought $45 for two was pushing it a little.

VCKd5Phb-MJfWxwqDti5wA.text: Consistently good service and food. Love the patio year round....and the $5 pitchers of Hoegaarden.  Recommend riding your bike there, they have a convenient bike rack.

JlOCtrF_vKTzP8YY9NASmw.text: I've been coming to this wonderful place for years, usually to catch up with my girlfriends to vent or gossip lol We love their Monday & Tuesday $20 special which includes a bruschetta board & a bottle of wine, SCORE!  This place gets packed by the time 8 o'clock hits so try getting here 15 minutes early. The atmosphere is laid back & just overall fun.

v3m2RPbx3oglOJ-RwgzIQw.text: Just as great as the one in Arcadia! Always visiting here when I visit from Houston. The Brie, Apple and fig spread and the prosciutto and figs are my favorite bruschetta!

9eY9156dxvaDgAsc9G0ZtA.text: I love this place. The days that I go are during lunch hour, so I haven't had a bad experience yet. The servers there are quite helpful and extremely funny.   The food is very delicious. I really liked their Mediterranean salad, the nine iron panini, the cheese board, the cucumber honey lemonade drink and arnold palmer.

MrLUx6jLi58y_lWHUZiUSw.text: Interesting food and great happy hour specials!  The paninis are fantastic and they really do have some good wine and beer to chose from

yrk8KsE-gJm6Ry8-AADvLg.text: Boy was I happy to see this place finally finished.  I've been driving by for months now, keeping a watchful eye on it, and now, finally, it is done.  I haven't been to the original in years so I can't really compare it but it feels the same.  Open, airy, industrial, fresh, and classy are all words I would use to describe it.  Really, a great conversion.  There is almost no parking.  It is a bit sickening to think about when you consider how crowded this place gets.  I appreciate transit oriented development as much as the next person, but the poor neighborhood around this is going to get mobbed.  The LRT is close but might be enough of a walk to turn people off (especially during the summer).  They have valet parking but I refuse to let anyone else drive my car so that was out of the question.  We parked across the street by the gas station, prayed, and ran across Central to get there.  There are like three entrances to this place but I guess you just sit wherever.  Service was good, friendly, and knowledgeable.  We were wicked disappointed that there was no sangria.  For a wine place, there should be sangria.  I had some Lion Stout beer that rocked my world.  The wife had some Riesling.  It was good too.  We ordered the NYC grilled cheese for a starter and it was great.  Came with pesto, mustard, and catsup and was sliced into like 6 small pieces.  It rocked.  I ordered some panino that was rocking a bunch of Italian meats, tomato, and some cheese.  It was great.  It came with homemade chips that would have been better with some more of that catsup.    The place was really just quality.  The crowd was good at 4 which was surprising.  The patio was packed.  The bar is pretty cool.  No hard liqueur but that's okay.  In all, well done!

lI7ajYszqrdVnsrzSEek_w.text: I give Postino's 5 Yum's for the delicious Bruschetta and the huge variety!  This is a great place to come with friends and have some wine and bruschetta. Nuf said!

f2S-muIYdqh17SVnfFf_vw.text: We had one of the bottles of Malbec, the staff was friendly, the atmosphere was open, the music was very hip lounge.  Parking is a bit sparse, but I was lucky enough to nab an off street spot.  I will stop by next time for something from the menu.  The Malbec was wonderful.

6zOULcaC2dk5CG7dohXS6g.text: Pretty hipster spot, but overall, a great place to go for good wine and food. The design and atmosphere goes well with the vibe.  The place seems to always be busy, so, keep that in mind.  FYI: You can't go wrong with the bruschetta, its pretty damn good.

attPklee1NNMgwbxwpddgA.text: $5 pitchers of Four Peaks brews? That's an awesome happy hour!  Bruschetta is amazing... $13 is a bit much for it, but still super tasty!  Great environment. Happy staff. Killer design and music.  Great location.  Love it!

HyPENav4Tz7eHZJt9WMUcQ.text: great, kind, monday and tuesday night specials are tto awesome

fru_M0t_YatCD4qa2fPZOA.text: Cannot get enough of this place!  -great location  -all the tables seem to have privacy, yet you still can see whats going on.  -the toilet paper is stamped with their logo (This means they got   somethin' good going on I'm sure)  -cheap during happy hour  -super cheap during happy hour ($5 pitchers everyday foo ' (I think between 11 and 5)  -Special $20 wine/bruschetta thingy.   -hot staff..except one guy yelled at me and my friend for smoking in the parking lot on our way to our bikes...whatevs.. we quit anyways!  -not too many douchey customers (that I've encountered)  -oh, and best hoegarden on tap i have ever tasted!  win winw inwinwinwinwinwinwi wiiiiin! Postinos...FTW!

2K1_vL-ZdI0sQNFqkVzewA.text: Favorite wine place! Every single bruschetta choice is AMAZING!

0MJaYYb963yyIMVwWhyG6w.text: This place is addictive and is going to get me into trouble.  The wine by the glass list is small but very good, when the food arrives it's even more interesting and tasty than you expected when you read about it on the menu (excluding the bruschetta which I found uninteresting), but I think the best thing is that this is a great place to hang out for an afternoon.  Staff are friendly but not in a goofy way, helpful when you need without being condescending and, unlike so many wine bars, professional in appearance and behavior.  Good people watching with a pretty diverse clientele.    I haven't done my usual Saturday chores for two weeks now, instead finding excuses to hang out here all afternoon.  baaaaaad  I prefer this location to the one on Campbell because it's airier and has better service.    Recommendations?  If you can't decide, get The Plate which has bits of all kinds of things, all of which are wonderful. Try the sparkling sauvignon blanc for a nice change from the typical white wine.  And of course try to do so before 5pm to get your wine for $5.

W3KtJUywIh7OxeqCyl5yzA.text: Postino's is the perfect addition to the 'hood. Great wine selection/value, sandwiches, salads and location. Bonus for the complimentary valet and awesome servers!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetarian on Focaccia
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mediterranean Salad
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata App

2U3Ngr1BRNfTVs8w120SXw.text: I did some day drinking at Postino yesterday and it was great.  The outdoor/indoor patio feel was awesome for getting out of the AZ sun.  They have $5 wine from 11-5 daily as well as average priced drafts and beers.  I had framboise (belgian raspberry beer) which was $10 ($12 at most other places I've been to).  They also let you take beer to go for 1/2 price which is really a good deal if you want to try something different but only want one to take home.  Or for my framboise that would make it $5 which is no different than what it would be at the store.  I didn't try the food but was drooling over everyone else's... there are a million kinds of bruschetta that looked really awesome.  The panini's looked decent as well.  The vibe is kinda of midtown, hipster, "FEZ-like" but it was quiet and relaxing too.  All around good place to have a mid-day drink and it's now on my list to go back and try the food!

4YVYS8Fj9ZwkAKlR6cenwQ.text: I loved this place. The food was good. I went here to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday at dinner time and it was an ideal place for celebration. We tried some soup, sandwich, and bruschetta, all of which was really delicious and we had a lot of leftovers because of the generous portions. The waiter came by frequently. The restaurant is located along Central, but its location is so close to a residential area that it feels to me to be more of a neighborhood hangout place and less of a huge Central Ave attraction. I will be coming again!

6Oq8C9IFuc0RAWsrZRyUVg.text: Food and wine were great as always, but the service left something to be desired. We were greeted and served quickly, but then our wine and water ran out and no one checked on us or removed the dishes. When we did finally get a chance to order more wine the server ran off without asking what we wanted. I guess she assumed we wanted to stick with the wine we started with, but we didn't. Dishes were not very clean. All around disappointing trip this time.

3-LzvHDPH9yKik_ACJhHtg.text: We saw that they were open on the Chow Bella blog yesterday and decided to go last night.  It felt just like going to the 40th St location, same menu, decor...but somehow better.    We ordered a couple of glasses of wine and a bruschetta and were very pleased with the service and quality of food.  The place was packed!  I think this neighborhood has been waiting for something like this for some time.    I won't miss the old Katz Deli too much though it was a part of local history; the new Postino is a welcome change and I love the openness of the back bar and patio.  It's a nice place and we will be back!  Oh, and expect to hear a lot of 80s new wave music, at least that's what was playing when we showed up...the Cure, Duran Duran, Depeche Mode seem to be their theme.  Like their other location, expect the finest breads from MJ Bread as well as tasty treats from Tammie Coe Cakes.  mmmmm.  And you'll need to use the valet unless you get there between 11-4 (and you'll get $5 wine for being early).

N5HC0NY2uucq9IawjO-nFw.text: I should start with the positives.. The food here is excellent. I have been here many times and the bruschetta is out of this world..the best I have ever had. The service is here is awful!! We went on a Friday night and even with 3 bartenders behind the bar  and a near empty bar, it was impossible to get service. They were very interested in talking to eachother though. They take empty glasses away without offering refills and when the food arrived I had to retrieve some silverware and plates since the bartender(s) didn't even acknowledge that we needed anything. No joke, it took almost 10 minutes to get the attention of that bartender to get another glass of wine or a beer. The food is what keeps us going back and they do have a great happy hour with $5 glasses of wine. We will try the other location next time to see if the service is any better there.

iyFY5kgPsqK6KICjwZ0KdA.text: Took the light rail from downtown to Postino's on a Saturday--felt downright cosmopolitan!  Got there just before 4PM, earning me a few bucks off my first glass of wine.  The patio was just about full, and within an hour there was a waiting list for both inside and outside dining, so try to hit this place during off-hours.  Service was friendly, and the bruschetta was great--for those who haven't done the Postino's thing before, you pick four flavors out of twelve and get a bite of each for each member of your party.  The peppers and goat cheese, the fig and apple, and the prosciutto were outstanding.  Paninis and grilled cheeses floating by looked delish.  Wine was reasonably priced, and a lot more so from 11-4.  You can watch the poor valets scurry about in the sun while you lounge on the patio, reminding you that you're glad you walked or light railed in.  The place is open-air, even inside, and I'm interested to see how it works in the heat of summer.  We had a perfect springtime afternoon in the sun on their patio--just make sure one of your foursome brings sunglasses. :)

vBMVCeombwfx8rib1lRHpg.text: Sorry Switch, My Florist, Bombaros, La Bocca, Main Ingredient, and other wine cafes that sell gourmet sandwiches and salads. Postino's has you all beat! Why you ask? Postino's has the best deals with consistent and high quality, delicious food and wine. I have been to Postino's on Central more than a handful of times and there is a reason I go back over and over. . . because you people make my dining experience so good.   First of all, Postino's has the best brucetta. Hands down! They use larger pieces of bread and their ingredients are really flavorful. Their sandwiches taste just a little bit fresher and yummier than other restaurants. I cannot put my finger on what it is exactly, but it is fabulous. They also have a great wine and beer program that changes every month. They seem to be able to incorporate different malbecs in their wine list, which is a super plus for me! Their new brunch menu is spectacular and although I have only ordered one thing on the brunch menu so far, I have seen the brunch plates come out of the kitchen and they all look so scrumptious.   Second, Postino's has deals that you just can't miss. Monday and Tuesdays after 8:00 pm you can order a bottle of wine and board of brucetta for only $20! $5 wine glass or pitcher of beer everyday until 5:00 pm. If you sign up for their email list, you get coupons for free meals occasionally. I just noticed that on Wednesdays they have a special word deal on facebook, when you write the word on a business card, you receive all glasses of wine for $5. During this time of recession, you make dining with reserve wine affordable.

GLFeFasSyLMqDdklZ8PC9A.text: Great little place for a glass of wine.  Everyone was very friendly and service was pretty good even though we were there on a Sat. night.  They were very busy but we managed to be seated right away.  We ordered the anti pasta tray and some bruschetta and they were really good.  It is a little noisy and a little dark but it was enjoyable anyway.  We will revisit for sure but I think we will pick a little less hectic time.

IlQy6SWVwrypl8Sl93OOqw.text: Postino Central Winecafe - Pretty cool history on Postino's. They take historic buildings and turn them into awesome neighborhood restaurants with amazing food, local ingredients and edgy culture. Oh and a great place for a first date!  If you're going for some appetizers, make sure you try the Mozzarella and Tomatoes! The Mozz is super fresh and those Caprese lovers out there will keep coming back for more.  Another go-to is the Butcher's Block - An assortment of artisan meats and cheeses served with tuscan beans, olives, asparagus, nuts and crostini. And I'm a sucker for olives. WOW! This plate has an amazing quality of meats and cheeses, with tons of extras, you can't go wrong here!  Great ambiance, great bar, did I mention the STAFF is awesome, friendly and has it together. Postino will always be a REILLY favorite, so thanks for being you!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Postino on Central
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside Patio Seating
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside Bar

6zhEfGvHoRdx_UGOeAp3bQ.text: We had a nice time last night at Postinos. It was more than an hour wait, which was annoying for a Tuesday night but the bruschetta was good as always and their after 8pm deal is a steal! I'm giving it 4 stars because the wait was really, really, long, and when we finally sat, they seemed too busy to serve us properly. We had to wait a couple times to get their attention but they were really busy!

1CGNlHUyoldXNyZLMo_xcw.text: I love Uptown Projects in general but I'm a big fan of how each Postino's is slightly different.  My usual location was the Gilbert location.  I love the consistency, it was the same friendly, great service and absolutely fantastic food as my normal regular one! I absolutely love the bruschetta board and living in the Netherlands it is one of the things I miss.

mjH3izKLT57qlVfCkwNf7g.text: Super hipster Phoenix restaurant. They have these flatbreads that are amazing! Try all of them. They're so unique and really like nothing I've ever had. The wine list is extensive and they carry some wines that are exclusive to their restaurant. Nice patio seating too. Good service. Great place to meet friends:). Love it!

TqCVK7oKJj_eXT8S3KYwmQ.text: I recently went back for the "happy hour" - 20 dollars for a bottle and bruschetta.   It's a great deal and as always the bruschetta was delicious! It's packed, I recommend getting there early and having a glass before 8

x7E44MZ9IYecG4bnaiPDOQ.text: I had to come try out the Central location of Postino's as I have only ever been to the Arcadia location.  I was not disappointed.  Not in the slightest!   The decor was beautiful and mood setting, the service was attentive and friendly, my wine, the Max Mann Riesling, was delicious and my soup and sandwich combination, the sausage and bean soup and prosciutto focaccia, was like a symphony in my mouth.   ^ In case you are wondering, that's like saying it was a party in my mouth, but classier.  Also, for all the old school Phoenicians, you'll understand when I say that I was able to sit there and magically transport myself back to the days when this was Katz Deli and I was eating another delicious sandwich in this very spot, about a million years ago.  I so easily visualized the old Katz deli counter right in front of me, it was kinda eerie..

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My husband&#39;s honey cucumber lemonade.  De-friggen-licious!!

j8rdFgScXs9YqLyI1olPLg.text: I love me some hole in the wall Italian spot where a large gentleman is in the corner being fed linguine by a beautiful woman.  They're out there.  There's a place on central that is just that.    Postinos isn't that, but they have excellent bruschetta.  Postinos is one of those newer restaurants that have a bunch of single speed bikes out front. And that's cool, because it truly is some of the best Bruschetta I've had the pleasure of trying.  Congratulations, guys.  I think you're really doing it there!  It really is a beautiful restaurant and the food is delicious.  I recommend the bruschetta.  Really can't go wrong.  A great date place.

5MWLJl7QVgfqXmM0G7i4qw.text: Cold and windy day so sat inside.  Consistently good food and wines 5 before 5 but this location doesn't have the pizazz of camelback or Kierland. Overall love the bruschetta and would order again service was attentive.  Just the neighborhood is meh.

cYL788okhyEqDaMS9JnHsw.text: Love. Love. Love. Love. Love. This place. The atmosphere, the ambience, the food, staff, everything is terrific! They have fantastic bottle and Board specials and are great for business meetings, dates, birthdays, family events (I wouldn't recommend kids, but it's been done).

YZZIuK-ivJYmo3LslKvGIQ.text: When my friend asked for a wine recommendation the waiter was less than helpful and annoyed she even asked. As an upper class wine bar, I'd hope the waiter would be happy to assist and recommend wines. Probably will not be back at this postinos location after tonight.

oUeH8Nc1JSvuiHfK8CaMRA.text: This place lived up to all the great things I've heard about it! We got a bruschetta board of the following... Ricotta, dates, and pistachios Spicy pepper and jam Warm artichoke dip Mozzarella, tomato and fresh basil. All of them were super tasty but my personal favorite was the ricotta, dates and pistachios. Such a great blend of smooth cheese and sweet dates!! Honestly perfection. Also the mimosas are made with fresh squeeze OJ! I also ordered the country toast which was toast, ham and eggs cooked however you like on top. I really wish I would have been able to finish it but it was not even lukewarm so I sent it back. But! Even though my main plate was not up to par, this place still deserves 5 stars because of the amazing service! All the staff was very attentive and they took care of most of the bill for my plate being cold. All places have flukes and my plate was just an isolated incident, at least I hope!? Nonetheless I will definitely be back!!

gPsKnKaTNYmq45coeIf2mg.text: I've only been here once, but holy moley was it ever delicious! I can't wait to come back!   We had no idea what wine to order, but our server was awesome, and so knowledgeable! He helped us pick the perfect bottle. Our bruschetta board was amazing!   Not only is the food and drink great, but the ambiance and service are top notch as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. OMG! Delicious bruschetta board!
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ambiance!

_Hyz8X24YlwN_dDQHwN-NA.text: The people who are there are also fun and great to be around. Its just a fun little outpost of the Postino family of restaurants. High quality ingredients, trendy ambiance, and friendly staff!

si10zUBxDxMDodNRAwfz3A.text: Love the Monday/Tuesday $20 bottle of wine and bruschetta!!!!! It's perfect for a girls night or to share! They have this delectable dessert that has caramel, pretzels, chocolate, and all this other yummy stuff! Would definitely go there again, and again, and again!

TRfwnQPAjephA9oNtrLomw.text: I love this place as well as everything on the Four Corners here. All the restaurants are owned by the same people and it's great food. Great drink specials and friendly service.

HrC9NZze6mWn3EKt6gIl8A.text: Great place to grab a quick bite to eat! Az weather has been in the 100+.... but even then the patio seating was very cool and comfortable.  We ordered their choice of 4 bruschettas, Hannah Salad/veg sandwich, and a Roast Beef sandwich. The bruschettas were sooooo good! Roast beed was not that great (too much seasoning), the salad was okay (in the future I will order it with dressing on the side.)  If you are looking for a light, quick bit Postino's is your place!

FMHc7NaB8jB27mMjry6O2A.text: Awesome atmosphere and great food! Love the drink specials. The waitress was helpful and stopped back multiple times to make sure we were okay.

AI3ruY235eKAGWrox4W2oA.text: Long over due! I used to live in Phx just down the street and this was always one of my favorite places!   Today I came here as my last stop before leaving Phoenix. I had my 2 dogs with me and we sat outside. A haboob was forming and they were ushering everyone inside. They offered to let my dogs be in the lobby and I even offered to just eat in my car with the dogs - they are service animals, specifically ESA, but I didn't have their vests or tags on me. They wouldn't even hear of it lol! They insisted on us eating inside even with the dogs, assuming my critters didn't bark or disturb other people. My guys are fairly good. They just hang out underneath the table or sit on a chair next to me when we go places.   I tipped them very well for the amazing customer service and making sure my 'fur-babies' were well taken care of. :)   Food wise - Bruschetta is second to none! It is truly the best I've ever had! I always get the cucumber honey lemonade! I have never had a bad experience here! I think they are few & far between and if someone does have a bad experience here then someone is just off on their game that day. It happens. Love this place, highly recommend! Whenever our CA people come to AZ we insist on them checking out Postino. Your life just isn't complete without trying it once :P

Myg5u7fMeT_30ivTWr_B-g.text: Too damn delicious. Servers get shared/pooled tips, which makes the restaurant move at a fast, friendly pace while maintaining an element of fine dining. As soon as I order my food with someone, it is entered and I've never had to wait long to get anything.  Must haves: Cucumber Lemonade, Bruschetta Board (at least 1 apples&brie), and for dessert, the Chocolate Bouchon is to die for!   There are always great deals on wine, so grab a bottle while you're there and celebrate

cwL6hbA9nDgASqMDd52rrA.text: We love this place! Great bruschetta(s) plus their salads are amazing! Iced tea is awesome as well!

0gvsuPK9Q9oCq1yEcEUWpg.text: This is the Postino I visit the least in the Valley since I'm normally at Windsor or Federal when I'm in the area. It's still a great place just like all the Upward Projects locations. I visited a few weeks ago to pick up their rose box, and the young lady helping me was very friendly and helpful.  In case this is the first review of you've ever read about Postino (no apostrophe S, thank you very much), here's the drill: come on Monday or Tuesday night for board and bottle. You get a board of tasty bruschetta and a bottle of wine for $25. Awesome deal! I've seen a few people complain that the price rose recently, and it makes me roll my eyes. There's no better deal (especially considering the quality of wine) in the Valley.

0M4aImXJJdYFXxLxIod-8Q.text: Would have been a 5 Star but for how BUSY this location is.   Amazing happy hour (which is why it is so busy?!) with wine and food specials.   You will be sharing your plates as I have not ever had a bad dish from this kitchen.   Classy mid - century vibe indoors and out.   Bring your out of town guests to show off Phoenix' dining scene!

dNAxDTyoSRy35kcIkSQYYg.text: I really liked the vibe of this casual bistro located on Central Ave. I met a friend for Sunday coffee and brunch and I was happy to see that I could bring my dog to dine with us on the patio! We arrived right at 9  am opening (hey, I get up early these days...) and were really the only patrons on the patio for some time.  Our server and the other staff were incredibly friendly and patient, never rushing us to order and keeping water and coffee cups full. It made for a super pleasant morning. My only complaint about Postino was they should have told us about the national potato shortage! That's the only realistic explanation I could think of for the skimpy serving of breakfast potatoes that came with my meal. It was actually pretty funny. I think we counted about 18 pieces of small, diced potatoes on my plate - about maybe a 1/4 cup worth. The eggs were good. The 2 strips of bacon were good. The coffee was good. The fruit salad was old. I thought the meal was a little pricey for my taste, but hey, you're also in a very cool atmosphere which is definitely worth something.  So no doubt I will return to this cool hipster patio to have cocktails and some bruschetta.

jxY6B2qJDeVxDouO4lvZsA.text: This may have been the first Upward Projects restaurant to grace this section of Central but it is the last one I got around to visiting. I was here to celebrate a friend starting a new job. A party of 6 without reservations on a Sunday afternoon we had to wait for seating on the patio for about an hour. Not unexpected and it was a gorgeous afternoon to just hang out and chat.  The patio seating was worth the wait. Service was a little slow as the place was packed. I had the Tuscan Tuna panini which was really good and also filling. I did not hear any complaints about the food in our group. I would definitely go back here.

AzLlqrMRENgpe7O9cYG_Dw.text: Feeling like Italian food so we went here for dinner. The restaurant and parking lot is a bit small. It can get really busy in the evening. They have inside seating and outside seating area with misters. They're very attentive when customer walks in so we got seated right away. The restuarant has a rustic modern feel to it. Mostly wooden bar and tables and wine rack in the aisle, I think it's very neat.   We ordered the bruschetta, which we can choose 4 toppings. We pick:  *fresh mozzarella, tomato & basil *prosciutto di parma, fig & mascarpone *warm artichoke spread *smoked salmon & pesto Then we ordered the vegetarian panini. Everything tasted delicious, except the fresh mozzarella, tomato & basil bruschetta it can use a little seasoning because it's a bit bland so we add little sprinkle of salt just for taste.   Service was great and he was very attentive to our table to fill up our glasses of water and see if we need anything else. Everything was great for dinner. I would definitely come back again for happy hour! Their happy hours are from opening until 5pm everyday with any selections of beer and wine for $5.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4XSWTYmlvCYSZdkk7h0aeA.text: The food here is always delicious! The service is also outstanding. They are so helpful and friendly! The patio is great and so refreshing, the misters are a huge benefit on a warm day.   We ordered bruschetta, of course, the sweet and spicy jam with goat cheese is great, and the Brie with figs is super tasty! It is like a dessert!   The charcuterie board is also filling and tasty.   This trip we also ordered dessert, creme brulee and the salted caramel sundae. The creme brulee is super tasty, with a perfect crunchy top! The salted caramel sundae is the perfect level of sweet and refreshing!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caramel sundae
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. creme brûlée
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta

mpDpKMt6TLNdPRzLNDT2QA.text: Great ambience, quick service, wide selection range and patio seating option. (What more do you need)  Ordered - Bottle & Board - De Martino Estate wine. Tasted really great, never had this before. Little higher on alc %, but a sweet deal.  You can pick 4 bruschetta options from the menu for your board : I picked  1. Brie, Apple and fig spread : mind blowingly delicious. Best one on the board. 2. Mozzarella, tomato and basil: okay-ish tasting. 3. Ricotta, dates and pistachio : top 2. You would literally moan after eating this. I'm serious. 4. Piquillo pepper and goat cheese : wouldn't recommend this.  Vegetarian Panini - quantity is huge for the price, worth a try.  This place is for wine lovers. Deals are good on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta board+ veggie panini
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crazy hour

uOdeWZ8DbHHaobjlD81LAQ.text: Recommended: If you like bruschetta and drinks, this is the place for you! Food: Tasty! Price: Decent Service: Great service!  Details: My coworkers and I came here after work on a weekday. This was my first time coming here. Now, I'm not a crazy fan of bruschetta, but I did ordered a few. I also ordered the skewer which it was also good, but kind of wish it wasn't $12 just for two skewers. The 2 skewers were one fish and one steak. However, for four bruschetta for $12, I think it's worth it. I like the salmon and the one with pesto the most. This place also has beer and wine. I ordered a moscoto for myself and it was really good. My moscato taste light and refreshing. Now I'm obsessed with the moscato brand that they had. AS for one of my coworker, she also ordered a panini along with an order of bruschetta but they never brought it out. My coworker didn't bother tell them about it because she got full already. But by the time we finished everything and they still didn't brought it out. She mentioned it to the waiter that she never got her panini order but it's okay since she was really full. They went to check it and saw they forgot about it, they still made her the panini and let her take it home. They didn't charge her for it since they forgot about it. I thought that was very generous of them to do that. Overall, I had a great experience here and so did my coworkers.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. More bruschetta~
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta~ I really like the bacon spinach tomato one. And the smoked salmon in the middle.
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Skewers

rzNYA0F_uB48_YwwbxqF3Q.text: Came by for some dessert and sour brews.  I was not disappointed.  Good atmosphere, good creme brulee, good brews, good service at the bar.  Didn't have the food at this location but I know the food is always good at Postinos.  Awesome spot in a great geographic location.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prairie Vape Tricks
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prairie Vape Tricks
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oro calabaza sour brew

dy9qG1p4t_Juzo3kXISBUQ.text: This is a fun, casual wine bar and the bruschetta is the best!  I love their $5 wines and beer every day until 5 pm and the service is always exceptional.

hgNVkPqUb3DN9HluWOMhZA.text: Came here on a Monday night with a coworker and it was SO WORTH IT! (The deals are really great!)  I had never had bruschetta before so it was an unforgettable experience regardless, but this place is something special.   I love the vibe. It is like an eclectic bar mixed with a modern Azteca but had class like a fancy steakhouse restaurant. (Hopefully, that makes sense. LOL) It was pretty packed when we came after work on a Monday night.   The bruschetta was very flavorful. I have come to learn that I will never crave bruschetta as my favorite food. (Did you know that most bruschetta is served cold?! I guess I missed the memo.) I can respect the flavors of a good cuisine, though so if that's your vibe, more power to you bro!  Overall, if I lived out here, I would love to visit again. (You know, to expand my pallet and all).  Very nice place.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eJgrshbsRKnJH_3TSOR8PQ.text: Postino is a must-visit spot in Phoenix! The atmosphere is amazing especially if you're able to sit outside on a nice day. I've brought many visitors here and everyone always leaves impressed with the bruschetta boards. I've also been once for brunch. I much prefer the bruschetta, but the food is always delicious. The best nights to come are Monday and Tuesday where you can get a bruschetta board and a bottle of wine for $20!! Such a steal!! My favorite choices include: Brie & apples with fig spread and sweet & spicy pepper jam with goat cheese. I always try the seasonal one as well because they are artists with bruschetta flavors!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MiysY8wo6v8G1amreRzEZw.text: Love this place and now so does my mom!   Brought my mom in while she was visiting from Texas.   She commented on the atmosphere numerous times and described the bruschetta bread as "amazing" and was surprised at the variety of choices.   Postino's is always a nice time. We always bring our our of town guests here.

1wRO-sw68It21-UFbUivqA.text: 1. Food: fair. It's not really really excellent but still good enough. It's worth to try at least one time in your life. We ordered the Board (pick 4). We picked Baked Salmon, Sweet and Spicy Jam, Salami and Bacon. In these 4, I love bacon most. Others are okay. We also ordered Nine Iron which is good. Score: 7/10  2. Service: good. Waiter and waitress both are nice and friendly. Service is also fast. Score: 9/10  3. Ambience: nice and romantic view. It has both inside and outside tables which is flexible for us to choose. It's excellent to have a date night there. Score: 9/10  4. Location: it's kinda in the heart of downtown. Parking is fair. We could find the parking right away but seem like around 20-25 lots. Score: 8/10  Overall score: 8.25/10. Nice to try at least one time.

GjkTQ65pluMNGL4REW-avQ.text: Great meal, the Postinos approach creates an atmosphere and is inviting and chic -- I always enjoy the vibe. The food was good as usual, especially the Brussels sprout salad with Manchego. I also recommend the Brie and Fig Jam Bruschetta. I can't wait to stop in again! Thanks to Stephanie for great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ns-XVLY21cgKYo_4iKSzBw.text: Wow! This place lived up to the hype. Went here Monday night for their $25 Board & Bottle special. Starts at 8pm we arrived a little early to grab a table  on the patio. Our service was great. You're close to other people but it didn't seem super loud or like you had to yell to hear the people at your table. I didn't have a single item that wasn't delicious. The warm artichoke & the burrata/bacon/arugula/tomato were my absolute favorites. Also had the: Brie/apple/fig & pepper jam/goat cheese.  They slice the bruschetta for you also which is so nice. Makes it easy to pick up and bite. Everyone I was with loved what they got also. AWESOME! A must go in Phoenix. Plus you can't beat the price. Also for the bottle - you get to choose any bottle from their menu! Whites, reds, rose, bubbles. It's a steal for $25. And if you don't finish your bottle they will cork it for you at no additional charge.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Closest to furthest: Barrata/bacon/arugula/tomato, pepper jam/goat cheese, warm artichoke, Brie/apple/fig

1iFnsbng_cDMD5W3aqoyUA.text: Just love coming to Postino's every time I come to Phoenix to visit. There are now a few locations, but my go to is located down Central. Monday's are one of my favorite days to come here. You can do a board of mixed bruschetta and a bottle of wine for $25. The list of bottles to choose from is pretty decent and the selections of bruschetta are hard to choose from; they're all equally delicious. This particular special starts around 8pm and goes until close. If you arrive a tad before, seating is usually not too bad. However, if you come a little later be prepared to wait at least up to an hour or longer. Staff here is always very friendly and patient considering this is one of there busiest nights. Overall, I can't wait to come back and divulge In more tasty bruschetta and delicious wine!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3IYObIdfdAymDEbYyDkjjw.text: I now understand why everyone loves this restaurant! I always thought, how can bread and toppings be that good? Well it is good, it is REALLY good! Plus, how can you beat a whole board and bottle of wine for $20? I ordered the Brie and apples, sweet and spicy pepper jam, burata, and roasted peppers with goat cheese. For wine I ordered the downtown red wine which was also great! The service was very friendly and atmosphere was awesome! I will definitely be back!

FX1761KgoNOYL2SyPO356Q.text: I love coming here. Postino has been my absolute go to in the Valley for about ten years. There are more locations now, but Postino Central was the first love and closest to my home in PHX. I love the outdoor seating here. Inside it can be a bit loud, but still a great atmosphere. The food hasn't changed much over the years and that's the best thing about it. The prices really haven't either. Getting a bruschetta board and a pub board to share is a great way to go. I also love their raspberry chicken salad. Really, anything is good. The $20 for a full bottle of wine and a board late night can't be beat. All day wine is $5 a glass or $5 for a pitcher of beer. I mean, come on. It's been that way for ten years at least.   On the weekends and evenings it is a cluster to park here and the wait can be long. To be fair, there is an additional lot across the street that is open for parking at all Upward Projects restaurants. But on a weekend it is slammed, too. Joyride, Federal Pizza, Windsor, Churn, and Postino are all right here and that is great - but busy by PHX standards. If you are from another major city, it will seem normal. But everything else is a steady 5 stars for me. If I could only go back to one of my Valley favorites, it would always be Postino.

dGARzJ0zH1aUW1U1o-eTsw.text: Always the BEST!   Love Postino's and the extra pleasure of seeing Jenny    It's been way too long!

WR5jZ2Q2JVZrScz8iFvVbw.text: I really can only give 3 stars this time. The Cheese Board is pedantic at best. This is one of my go--to places and I have enjoyed nearly all of the food. The Cheese Board, not so much. More nuts and dried fruit than cheese. Three cheeses, two of them dried out. And sliced cheese. Yes sliced. No one serves slices of cheese on a good cheese board. This could be much better.

f4Z7K2YJcPB8AqS7KDVhuQ.text: Way overpriced. No airflow, ZERO. literally both times I've gone there everyone in this place is sweating. This place is a flat out uncomfortable wine bar. There are 100 just like it in every city. This is where over dressed mouth breathers in clown makeup go to talk about books they have never read and spend money they don't have on shit they can't afford. This isn't "cultured" it's pretentious. The kind of place where cowardly women gather to talk shit incessantly about work and their "friends". If this bar were a person it I would arrange to have it thrown screaming from a helicopter.

CTUj8gUS9fMD3bKJaJibeg.text: This is always the go to spot for brunch any day of the week! For brunch, we (GF and I) always kick off with the board of course. Apple, Prosciutto, Salmon, and Peppers is always the best combo for the board, in our opinion. For a brunch entree, I get the Country Toast, she gets the B.E.L.T. You can't pass up on the $5 pitcher of Odell by the way. Always great music playing outside by two gentlemen.

mXRrFWcREsmJBFhL0Fv9nQ.text: You cannot go wrong here.  The food and atmosphere are outstanding and worth the wait.  The bruschetta with tomato jam and sheeps milk cheese is my fav and pairs perfectly with a nice malbec. I've tried every version of their bruschetta and have not been disappointed.  I can't wait to go back, in fact, I will tonight, I'm taking my good friend who is new to town for dinner.

Mp-8fjw2j7n3DOkJo1o-tw.text: The absolute best! I've been here MANY times and I've never had a bad experience. They always get our orders right, the staff is friendly and attentive and, most importantly, the food is always divine! You really can't go wrong with anything that you order. Enjoy!

G0vUQA6LQw4AL_wQMIySDQ.text: Went to Postino Central Monday night and it was a great time. There are 10 types of bruschetta on the menu and we sampled eight of them.  All were really good and the $20 bruschetta and wine special (Monday & Tuesday nights, 8 - 10) was a killer deal. The atmosphere was fun and the place was full on a Monday night. The thing I liked most though was that each piece of bruchetta was sliced so it could easily be picked up as finger food.

WprdDS1dY1fhEimNBDSpXg.text: Heard many great things about this restaurant. So the family decided to try it out. We were greeted quickly and friendly,  and it seems like a nice place.   The waitress was pleasant. And took our drink order immediately. Within a few minutes our drinks were brought by someone else to the  table.   However,  that was the last we saw of our waitress. She never came back to take our food order. And passed by the table  multiple times and never once looked in our direction.  Though she continued to go back and forth between her other tables.   I was looking forward to trying this place. I heard so many great things. But no matter how good the food is, if the service is bad,  no one will want to stay to eat it.  We will not return to this location.

ePbhkgfdWRB7IptafwMxTg.text: I've officially been to all three Postino locations. This restaurant has to be one of my favorites in AZ thus far. The bruschetta is to die for, the salads fresh and light, and of course, the wine never fails. This location is much like the Gilbert location in terms of ambiance and crowd. Cool decor and even cooler coed restrooms =]

2tKVuGLUbgdZTMj_h6Xiqw.text: I try to go here every chance I get. If I have a lunch meeting and I think in any way the person I am meeting can make it to Postino, that's where our meeting will be.  Have never had a bad meal. Service is great and who would complain about fantastic mid week wine deals! Bruschetta board= delicious! The hardest part is picking which one to have.   You can go here for a night with friends, working lunch, a date, and even bring your children.  They offer a fantastic, well balanced menu and some fun giveaways for the little ones.

c2nJemvMQ08NTjko6HJDvw.text: Yup, good! Great appetizer plates and drink selection. And.the.best.panini. I ordered the prosciutto and Brie Panini...hold the prosciutto....but the waitress suggested apple slices in the place of the meat. Holy moly, best sandwich ever. With the fig jam and the warm brie......drool..... Everyone else at the table wanted a bite and we all thought about it for days. Also good....the salted caramel sundae- shared one...and again, everyone wanted a bite, then they ordered their own. How can a dessert that comes with a shot of hot caramel be anything but good?

BQjiNUKmFt0cT10ZJwHDBA.text: Lately it seems that all my (Arizona) friends ever talk about is Postino (okay, maybe futbol too). So when I was in Phoenix a few weekends ago, I wasn't the least bit perturbed when our reservation for Tuck Shop fell through and we ended up there.  The atmosphere was mature which I seem to enjoy more and more these days, and the decor was that of Elizabeth Taylor's demeanor: chic, but not uptight. The structure of the dining area was impressive, giving several options to patrons. There were bistro tables for two, a long wooden raised table with benches for a large group, of course the bar, a sexy booth for a smaller group, and then an area (where we sat) that had some modern couches and fabric chairs and a little trunk / table. And the music selection was even better. Cozy can't even begin to sum up that place.  The wine selection was wonderful and the servers were charismatic. The food was so delish, although everything does seem to run on the cheesy side, so if you're lactose intolerant like I've become, then talk to your server or order one of their amazing salads. Overall, everything was great, great, great.  When I'm in Phoenix again, I'll definitely be going back to Postino!

tdIsT4p0nGn05PsN8rx3tw.text: Omg. Food porn. The bruschettas are freaking amazing! We got: Brie & Apples, Roasted Peppers with Goat Cheese, Prosciutto with Figs & Mascarpone, Bacon and Arugula. OMG, it was so good. For the main course, I had the "select two:" chicken and mozzarella panini and raspberry chicken salad. Holy salad and sandwiches, they were delicious! The best part, apart from the food, is the ambiance of the place and the people! The servers were very nice, and accommodating. Oh, the bathrooms are unisex! Very cool.

nJfMduXVtS0N0lIdwcey7Q.text: I went here last weekend with my girlfriend after discovering Postino on the Whistl app for iPhone. We saw the deal for a bottle of wine and bruschetta for $20 and just couldn't pass it up.  The restaurant was beautiful on the inside, and had a very cool, semi-secluded outdoor patio that made you feel like you weren't even in the city!  We go the Salami with Pesto, the Burrata Bacon, Arugula & Tomato, the Smoked Salmon with Pesto, and the Warm Artichoke Spread. Every one of the them was absolutely delicious. My favorites were the Burrata and Bacon, as well as the Smoked Salmon. The bacon was thick, not burnt or too crispy. The tomato and burrata complimented the smokiness of the bacon very well. The smoked salmon was extremely fresh, it reminded of growing up on lox and bagels. It was the kind of thing you could eat for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The other two we're also great. The salami looked like artisan meat, not just something you get at the store. From what we've heard, their Butcher's Block (meats and cheese) sounded amazing, and looked delicious, too. The Warm Artichoke Spread was everything that you'd expect. Not too creamy, like some restaurants make, it was perfect.   We cannot recommend this place enough, and we can't wait to try the rest of the bruschetta's!  If you're foodies like us, make sure to check out the Whistl app for iPhone! We've been using it regularly and have found so many new great places!!  Happy Eatings Everyone!

yVVcsaUdG2WZ8HXajPNdXQ.text: Had a fabulous brunch here. The price was right, the atmosphere great, food was great, easy access, very nice staff....

RDL-mbh788Dn3vZhZY5pJg.text: Their Monday Tuesday special is the best!!!!!!!!!!! I love the fig, Brie, Apple bruschetta!!

SVvgYFiNszipy-WQjvFE0g.text: This is where to be on Monday or Tuesday nights after 8. The $20 Board & Bottle deal is unbeatable, and the vibe is cool and hip without being stuffy and overdone. It's a great place to take my young or yuppie clients for a nosh and drink, and they always have a wonderful time.  Their wine list seems to change quite frequently, and they always have a great selection. And they have a pretty good beer selection too, for those non-wine drinkers (I'm still questioning if those folks are human or not).   My favorite bruchetta is......umm.... all of them. I love going with 3 or 4 girlfriends, because we can get one of each kind, and bathe in the deliciousness.   Check it out, you won't regret it! Tip: Get there before 8 if you don't want to be waiting in line for half an hour!

sDOCGjc47E7FcJOhApUKVw.text: I've been to the Postino in Tempe and this location blows that one out of the water. The ambiance is so much better with warmer lighting at night making it ideal for a date. I was there on a Friday night and there was no wait which was amazing. The service was quick as can be and we received our food and drinks so fast. I am definitely going back!

rM4kl8SJFJceciTt2CTAXQ.text: I don't get into downtown Phoenix often but when I do...I sure as heck make a pit stop here.  Tried it for the first time about 6 months ago after a visit to the art museum.  Loved the layout, style and atmosphere of the building.  They make you feel welcome right when you walk in and the wine specials...OH, the wine specials!    As many have mentioned, you can't go wrong with the bruschetta board.  I usually go with a friend and we split that and a dessert and always leave totally satisfied.    Definitely a gem!    Did I mention the wine specials? ;)

NIt_sJ7atEoEzCKo2eWpcg.text: I love Postino. I love it so much. I am here much more often than I'd like to admit and I just wanted to remind everyone of how much I love it.   The food is delicious and the service is always excellent. Jenny is our personal favorite...she's prompt, friendly, and never misses a beat. Plus, she always remembers us (even when we're not in her section). =)  See you next week!

l8PrnWm3qhGV6lWME6-4ng.text: I must post a note on Postino's because it needs to be a part of my life.  It should be THAT place where "everybody" knows your name or that Go To spot when family and friends are in town and you want to make some kind of an impression. Recently met some girlfriends there for Happy Hour (which runs from 11 am to 5 pm daily) and our servers, Patrick and Kristen, made the experience even better.  They were so positive and attentive but in a way that was not obnoxious. Postino's atmosphere felt as if you were sitting at your friend's kitchen table.  It's spacious, well lit and the decor is not heavy. Man, their meals are big.  If you go, it's better to share even though the price is reasonable. I'd like to suggest that you valet park and make sure you have cash to tip the attendants.  It took me 10 minutes to parallel park my car, but that's beside the point I'm trying to make here...tee hee.

_ODKrTFd5oZH-vaMae285A.text: We had the Tuscan tuna panini with the side salad. Delicious. Servers were super friendly and attentive.

1kSQWi9kEqCb8O3hPjfgAA.text: Not a fan of this location. I was so excited to go in as I love the arcadia postino. I experienced really slow service and so-so bruschetta.  I will return, as it is a great location, and perhaps just having an off day....

31uDDmW6awas6WkFv3h0xQ.text: Have loved this place for years! Do yourself a favor and get a bruschetta board and grilled cheese. The grilled cheese is the best kept secret on the menu. First place I go every time I'm back in town. What a spot. Great staff and service, too!

CztswJTqHTGX1jYbd4pWEA.text: I come here on Mondays and Tuesdays.  The bruschetta board and wine special is great! I really like it. The wait staff are always very accommodating.

PEJ0WG-wg6ArC5WTMrEH8g.text: Back when this place was Katz's Deli, I looked at the grungy, pallid walls, the worn vinyl booths, and the dreadful florescent lighting and thought to myself: "Wow, this place would look better gutted".   And yes, yes it does.  Nice brunch menu that's priced surprisingly well, comfortable atmosphere (and really nice booths), good coffee and service with a smile.   New favorite.

NAh5_wQ7yHPAfCdaffTMog.text: Amazing!! if you are visiting the area you must try this place!!! the food was great and the atmosphere was cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. tomato/cheese, salmon/pesto, salami/pesto, seasonal--veggie/cream cheese

zQ0faDAw7h98zOCA7MuTew.text: I am alllllll 'bout that Bruschetta life. They have the best from what i've tried so far. Also at such a good price for the amount you get.   I've also tried the Bruschetta at La Bocca on Mill ave, but it's definitely not on the same level as Postinos. If anyone has any other suggestions, let a broad know!!!!

GoLm8j_xv3XZQRe71rhN9A.text: First Timer. What a great experience.The food was delicious. More on the light weight side, Paninis and items like that. Had lunch there today. The service was right on target. The place was nice and full, but not overflowing. The lemonade I had was the best lemonade on the planet. Had a Cucumber taste to it. Pricewise, I believe was fair. This was just an overall pleasant experience, worthy of repeat visits. Can't wait to come again. Very nice job folks. Keep up the greate work...

RSgQu5cLEUGLPOhg49phfA.text: I love this place.  $20 for a bottle of wine and bruschetta?  Heck yeah.  It's super crowded on Monday/Tuesdays nights when they have this special, but its worth it. The bruschetta is delicious.  I've had nearly all of tjem and they are always delicous.

uZIVS0fi5LqAZ-XJKTAdPw.text: Service was really friendly and because of the long wait and giving up our table, they bought us our first round. That was lovely of them.  The wine was pretty decent. The Bellini is quite bad but I'm used to the blended ones. The bruschetta was really good, the buratta one being my favourite.   The chicken salad was delicious. Probably the freshest and interesting mix of flavours I've tasted.  Great atmosphere, great service, pretty good bruschetta and great chicken salad. Overall, great, and I'd go back when in the area.

-_P6eMN56AbqU6fRrTKvxw.text: Nine Iron panini was yummy and fresh. The organic chips weren't awesome. Will try the side salad next time. But first I will try this 'amazing' bruschetta everyone raves about.  Great customer service! Convenient location although if you are traveling north on Central, if you blink, you may miss it.  Atmosphere is simultaneously energetic, romantic, and relaxing. I had a to-go order but didn't want to leave.  Will definitely be back!

-7FgnqIs4gbqWKjA2mic5A.text: What can I say that no one else has?  Postino is a cool little wine bar.  It's also one that you don't need to dress up in black like a starving artist or Scottsdale nightclubber in order to fit in.  Postino has a bright and modern ambiance and awesome food.  The bruschetta is fantastic.  We tried (from best to not quite best) the white bean with tomato, smoke salmon pesto, brie apple and fig, and mozzarella with tomato and basil.  I could have kept eating all of them until my stomach exploded.  The flavor combinations were amazing and the ingredients were fresh.  If you can't find one that you like, you my need to have your taste buds examined.  We also split a chicken and mozzarella panini.  Delicious.  The sun dried tomato mayo and the arugula are a tasty complement to the protein.  The sandwich is as fresh and well prepared as the bruschetta.  Add a glass of wine and you have the perfect little meal.

6tPOIAgqszcmKoO_V2R9iA.text: How can you go wrong with anything at Postino's! I went during lunch one day as it's not far from my office. I sat at the bar and had great service. I had the 4 choice bruscetta and everything came out quick and very tasty! I cannot wait to stop in again for lunch soon.

bmscVZbync1I4MBJ_jqQyQ.text: Great spot for any dining experience.  I recommend the bruschetta board and thy have a wine/bruschetta every Monday/Tuesday for couples.

zmc05Z3NYcssWMHyswd8Dw.text: Such great service! Me and my boyfriend went, and a couple with a baby had a small table compared to us so we switched them- and the waiter thanked us and gave us free drinks! Such a kind, fun place to eat. The food was amazing. Definitely will go again, as it was our first time!

vi1O57LKUaIqZXQhoKjhSQ.text: What can I say about Postino's that hasn't been said time after time. This is our favorite Central Phoenix wine bar. As the first Upward Project restaurant in Central Phoenix, Postino's really started the uptown restaurant revolution, opening before many of our other favorites such as St Francis. Their happy hour is incredible, and makes this a great place to chill on a weekend afternoon as you enjoy some beautiful Arizona weather. The staff is awesome, the music rocks and the food is great. Five star all the way!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TQONtndCl2pcC523T69Vjg.text: I mean you can't go wrong with five dollar pitchers of beers on tap before 5 o'clock Postinos is our staple place  for my friends to get together for our weekly powwows. Then add their  bruschetta to share with the group... Just fab We frequent the Arcadia Postino's but this one was popping on a Friday night  a little loud but staff was friendly and food was up to par Will return  Dress code: casual to business casual

IjJd04JF_ITcVASOPSMuZA.text: I'm absolutely in love with the vegetarian panini. I'm not a vegetarian and never thought I would like a vegetarian sandwich, but this one is amazing. I've also tried their soups of the day and the Sunshine Daydream salad. I honestly haven't tried anything I haven't loved. Their customer service is wonderful too. The place has a nice ambiance perfect for happy hour, date, or casual meal. I look forward to going back to try more items from their menu.

NwGGn1HL4LZe6omiWNKdgA.text: First impressions are first impressionas. 25 min wait? I've new waiting on an hour and 45 mins. This place is great food wise (I hear), but seriously on a Mon or Tues, if you're telling folks "only 25 mins" and they're still waiting 2 hrs, its pretty ridiculous.  Get your seating system straight. We (table of 4) left, tired of waiting. Tons of great restaurants just around the corner.

IslrudY6bv9Wbis3JLs1KA.text: Love this place, next to Christophers, where I work at, The wine selection is amazing.  Wonderful dessert and sandwiches.

RCbzWk073hazheQNjbv6eg.text: This place was awesome! As soon as we walked in we were greeted and welcomed. We were immediately seated. Jenny was fantastic. Amazing customer service brought us our drinks and took our orders right away. The meals were perfectly portioned and delicious. All waiters were very friendly and attentive. Will return. Recommended!

Gu3YXKlgFsZEAfLxXEXsUg.text: Ugh, talk about douchebag central.  We came here looking for some dinner (as in: entrees), but their menu left much to be desired in the "actual food" department, so we ordered the damn "cheese and meat plate" which was boring, small and tasted terrible.   We also had, like, 7 different servers for some inexplicable reason, who wouldn't listen to ANY of our requests to stop filling up our water glasses every 3 seconds.  We didn't want water, we wanted food.   We ended up going across the street to the Italian joint because we wanted real food instead of a frikkin crackers and crappy lunch meat.  This is good for the whole Ed-Hardy-40-something-year-old-popped-collar crowd and their 22 year year-old consorts to meet up from their ads on Craigslist; but otherwise this place is awful...which is weird because their sister business, The Windsor, is absolutely amazing.

aZn7JFaNjBaTpsxhdIAVnA.text: As always... The staff here is amazingly friendly creating a warm and inviting environment.  I love this place!

pp4arIWAecMei--tK5yX-g.text: I enjoy every experience that I have at Postino.  Their happy hour is pretty decent, not that they are expensive in the first place.  I pretty much order the same thing every time I go.  The bruschetta is a must every time.  Anything with fig is a must.  Also, the paninis are delicious. Service was just fine, nothing to rave about.

rP9-2BfLUXLcBgGsxchUjw.text: Great service, great food, and great drinks.  The best brushetta hands down in Phoenix and a tasty meat and cheese board.  Yum!

pk-UWriPzkwEHUcjQjYqSQ.text: I give this 5 stars on the premise you get here before 5 pm for $5 wine happy hour and get the bruschetta! Favs were prosciutto with figs and mascarpone, roasted peppers with goat cheese, bursts, bacon, arugula, and tomato, and the Brie & apples with fig spread (FYI: very sweet). The only boy in the group got the Nine Iron panini and wasn't crazed so I definitely suggest sticking with the bruschetta!!!! The artichoke in the Bella Postino was yummy, but the hummus was just okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Postino Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delish!!!

bKylg3ZEVKmv1LDPpe1pXw.text: Last night, I went on a date and was taken to Postino Central. I think I'm going to marry him just for his taste in food and wine :)  To begin, the hostess let us know it would be a 30 minute wait. She took our name down and obviously heard me whining to him about how hungry I was... so she came back about 10 minutes later and seated us. That was incredibly sweet of her and I knew the customer service would be awesome.  So, the waitress tells us the special was bruschetta and a bottle of wine... for $20. I couldn't believe what she was saying. $20... for an entire bottle of wine AND four different selections of bruschetta? Is this real life?   Yes, yes it was... and I was in heaven. We ordered salmon, tomato & mozzarella, artichoke, and white bean (which turned out to be hummus, yay!) and I feel those are the top four in my book. We also ordered the Pinot Grigio and it was a perfect combination. For dessert, he ordered an espresso ice cream and I ordered the chocolate cake with vanilla bean ice cream... both to die for.   Then the bill came, and it was less than $35 altogether. So, I was a cheap date and happy to be so for this place! I can't wait to go back - 10 stars if I could!

uC4CTVgLgBaHfgZXjPPJAA.text: I can't say enough good things about Postino.
